text: We love love love  Dr. Brassart. However the lack of caring when calling for a sick child is pretty shy of perfect. You are placed on hold for quite sometime just for someone to go back in forth with a nurse about your visit. Having a sick child is hard enough but trying to get her into the office when the staff on the sick side would rather argue with the nurses over the issue is a bit ridiculous.

name: Kawana Davis
text: My children have been going here for 11 years and I simply love it! We absolutely love Dr. McDuffee! She is very thorough with my kids exams, she answers all of our questions and explain everything. I have never felt rushed or that we are just another number to them. The office staff and the nurses have been just as wonderful! They will always be our choice for our family. Awesome!

name: Matthew “Matt S”
text: We use cornerstone pediatrics for my two boys. they've been attending since they were little and it's always a great experience. Their office has a six side and a healthy side. So it is nice to know that you're not going to get sick every time you're going

name: Shannon Smith
text: Cornerstone is top notch! Our doctor is Dr Tatum. She's very caring, understanding & actually takes time to address all your questions &/or concerns. However, we have seen multiple doctors here & mostly all of them are amazing.

name: Alana Mobley 17147
text: Cornerstone Pediatrics is a great place. They have been taking care of my triplets for the past 10 years. I willingly drive 45 minutes because I NEVER have to wait. It is worth my drive, every single time.  I truly appreciate how they try to make my life easier. They love my kids. They are friendly, professional, and very efficient. We love Cornerstone!

name: Cassidy Mayfield
text: I saw Dr. Van cleave today for the first time & had a great experience. I loved my previous pediatrician as well but Dr. Van cleave spent much more time with us & answered all of our questions. Great front office & nurses as well!

name: F R
text: We’ve been going here for almost 5 years. We love every doctor there. They have all been good with my kids. The wait is usually very short, the clinic looks and smells clean, and the doctors listen to my concerns and takes them seriously (even when seeing a dr other than my primary). I’ve had nothing but positive experiences with the insurance/billing department, as well. We love Cornerstone.

name: Currie Thompson
text: I went to Cornerstone Pediatrics as a child and I now take all 3 of my children here. All of the doctors are caring, compassionate, and take the time to listen to any of my concerns. We typically never have more than a 5-10 minute wait regardless of which side we are on (sick or well). They are quick to call back and answer questions, and are willing to work with us on any concerns we have.

name: Emily Vandagriff
text: Our family has been at Cornerstone for 10 years. I am overall very pleased with the level of care, expertise and customer service. I have three kiddos who are always taken care of.

name: dawn roden
text: We love the doctors and the staff!

name: Amanda Dickey
text: I've been trying to change my children to this recommended pediatrician but they never have any openings for new patients with Medicaid

name: Alicia Uhrich
text: The quality of care is extremely poor. The staff takes things too personally and are very unprofessional, and our doctor (Dr. Denny) cared more about the personal feelings of his nurses than he did about our very sick 2 month old lil girl. This place is all about the money and their own staff, NOT the patients!

name: Stacey Brim
text:
I would like to thank Dr. Kimberly Miller.  She is a wonderful pediatrician.  She is very pro active in her treatments regarding both my children.  Very dependable and intelligent not just book smart but listens and does a thorough medical assessment before making her decision in how she will treat my children’s medical issues. I feel that many doctors are missing these qualities now a days.  Dr. Miller do not ever lose these qualities.  Thank you and your staff for being there for us.

Thanks Again!
Stacey, Connor and Elijah

name: H P
text: Nobody here will remember you or your child. You’ll be a chart number, a monthly debit for their accounts. Questions won’t be answered. No one will answer the phone. If they can’t bill it they won’t help you.  Not the place that informed parents want their child to be.  Too much chaos for the doctors to really know what’s going with your child.

name: Carly Lee
text: We have always been pleased with the care provided here. It is hard to get through on the phone sometimes but that is understandable as so many trust this team with their children's health care. Top notch care from start to finish with the office staff, nurses and doctors.

name: Danielle Calvert
text: We are always very happy with Dr. Brassart and the service we receive. They seem to genuinely care about my son and his well being, and have been very supportive of us as we begin our journey into parenthood. My only complaint is with the phone system, when trying to make a same day sick appointment one day I sat on hold for 20 minutes without speaking to anyone. Had to call back multiple times and go through the same thing before we were able to get my son in to be seen. But the medical staff is great

name: Sarah Morin
text: So disappointed by this place. My son is only 2 months old, and after his first check up I recommended this office to anyone who asked because I thought it was so great. It was pretty dirty, and smelled awful, but I thought I could overlook that for how great our doctor was. I have not had the same experience since. We went in today for his 2 month shots and there were a million issues. We received bills because they said it looks like no one ever charged our insurance, even though they said that last time too (the women in billing either blame eachother or just forget it was them whom I spoke to before). The women who gave him his shots made us feel like it was just something to quickly get done to get to the next room, even though they should know that was a big deal for both my newborn and myself. No one mentioned he would be in so much pain afterwards, which would’ve been a nice warning as he has been in pain all day. Just don’t go here if you really want your kids taken care of, they’re in too much of a rush to even know you from the next person. Bad bad bad.

name: Jessica Syme
text: They take very good care of my little boy.  I especially love the same-day sick visits. I really am confused on talking about the staff of the other reviews, all the times I've had to deal with any of the staff, they have been wonderful and understanding! We see Dr. Tatum and she is very considerate and helpful. I love how they talk to the child and try to let them know they are there to help. I wouldn't go anywhere else! The nurses, staff, and physicians are wonderful! No complaints! :)

name: April Spurling
text: We have 2 children that go here. Our son was sick for 6 weeks and all we would get told was it's viral. That he would get over it. We took him to the ER. They have him a steroid shot and the next day was better. Our daughter had been running a high grade fever for 2 days, cough, and congestion. Her left earelooked good and her right ear had a little clear fluidfand her tube was out. l get told it's viral that if she's not any better or her symptoms get worse to call back Monday. So I call Monday at 8:15, when they open and wait forever for someone to pick up. They NEVER answer the phone. Finally he says her ear infection must be coming back and calls her on some antibiotics. So we wanted a second opinion. This is day 6 of a fever and getting worse. So we take her somewhere else and she had acute sinus infection and bronchitis. Plus her right tube was still in. So her normal pediatrician from Cornerstone had lied to us or did t have any idea what he was doing. So we are changing pediatricians. We don't take our kids health as a joke and we don't expect their doctor to either!!!

name: Hannah Smith
text:
We love Conerstone !
Would highly recommend them.
They have an awesome staff.
We have seen Dr. Tatum & Dr. Miller; both are both amazing doctors!

name: Katherine Vega
text: Been patients here before and they denied my children for not showing up for a care visit. Well we moved to Texas for a year and came back to Alabama and they denied us from coming back. I’ve never heard of anything like this before. I even requested medical documentation from cornerstone to their new pediatrician office in Texas. I don’t understand how my children are still denied from the practice.

name: John & Stacey Gardner
text:
Getting ahold of them is awful. Even for something as simple as scheduling an appointment. They don’t turn their phones on until mid -Late morning. Your best way to contact them is to drive there And walk in. If you call for the nurse/same day line prepare to be on hold 20-40 minutes and perhaps a dropped call in there once or twice.  This is not an isolated incident but every time I call, only been patients there since we moved here 11 months ago.
Providers are great with kids, but need to actively listen to the parents. Love Dr. Tatum, she will listen to me.
Otoscopes in many exam rooms appear to be delinquent on inspection.
The phone thing, however is the biggest  issue. It’s so unprofessional.  They want us to show our kids not to spend all day using a electronic device but when you’re trying to contact cornerstone, be prepared to be on your phone until you are frustrated enough to drive there’s.  I will be leaving as soon as I find a pediatrician in town accepting new clients

name: Alicia Wiley
text:
My children had a well child appointment that we were unexpectedly unable to go to. We had a family member get admitted to Huntsville Hospital the day of the appointment. As I explained this to them, in tears, to cancel our appointment, all they said was that I would have to pay a fee. They are not family oriented and had no empathy for our situation. They called me telling me they expect a phone call back by the one of the day to get their money. I would not suggest this clinic to anyone I know!!!  Hateful and rude!!
Sincerely, Alicia Collier

name: Christina And olivia
text: I have had my two daughters there for over a year and I really like the group of doctors.  We see Dr. Van Cleave and he is always so sweet with my girls.  Most days we are in and out fairly fast. I love the same day sick appointments.  Also, it was really nice that one Saturday after we had my youngest daughter in that week, Dr. Van Cleave called from the office just to check and see how she was doing.  How many doctors take the time to do that on the weekend?  So far I haven't had any problems with the front office staff and the nurses are always helping me get both of my girls back to the room.

name: Pauline P
text:
So disappointed. Been taking the kids since We moved here in 2015. Our son is special needs and we frequently go to specialists in Memphis. But he also “needs” a regular physician he see’s once a year for forms for school. OT, PT, Speech etc etc. all the doctors fax his physician so he can fill them out. Never had a problem, in the beginning. Called spoke directly to his nurse and had stuff done fast and efficiently. This is the only reason we see him. But in 2018, suddenly it is $10 for him to fill out forms. Hmmm...little double dipping.....they told me I could make another appointment and he could fill them out then. really??? So pay you a copay, then you get paid by my insurance for the visit....or pay you to sign your name (because all is already filled out) to each page for 10 a page.
Another weird charge. We had an emergency (death in the family) and had to leave for FL. Didn’t even realize till we got back that our daughter had one pill left of her medicine. Called and left a message (cause getting someone on the phone is a worse chances than the lotto) about this. Low and behold two hours later they call and say that it will be $20 to do rush and pick the RX up today. Seriously??? A medicine she has to take everyday to function, that events out of my hand happened and they tell me this. This office is all about money. I’ve never had an office charge something like this. I can understand missed appointment fees. But a rush fee?? Fill
Out form fees....a performance that is part of your job? Seriously?? Yeah, love the doctor, but have no respect for his ethics of input of how his office should be run.
Will be finding another physicians

name: Angelica Ryan
text: 4 Stars for Doctors and Nurses. Check-in/Check-out desk is also 4 stars. However, their phone system is terrible. That gets 1 star. Expect to wait 20-30 minutes when you call for a same day sick appointment or to speak to the nurse. Also the entire office goes to lunch at the same time for one and a half hours 11:45 -1:15 Good luck getting anyone on the phone during that time as well. Their off hour answering service is no help.

name: Kelly Lankford Madden
text: I called about my newborn after the doctors office I had been going to for ten years would not see my newborn because we were 0 mins late and would not address a concern I had with only 2 other people in their lobby! So my cousin suggested I call Cornerstone  pediatrics  well I did and she told me to bring my newborn born in right then I got there and only stayed and hour total with filling out paperwork the doctor that seen my son was very thorough and mad sure he addressed all of my concerns  they also have bible scripture on the wall loved it!!!

name: Neal Cole
text:
Cornerstone Pediatrics are the most concerned, thorough, conscientious and diligent doctors, nurses and staff I have ever known. Plus they stay on top of all the issues continuously.

Secondly, the wait time to see a physician is infinitesimal.

name: Heather White
text: After taking my children there for almost 7 years, I was sent a bill for a PHONE CALL to the doctor when my child was severely burned. I understand our pediatrician left the practice but since he left, I have not enjoyed this office. I've called several times regarding this and no one wants to help. I never signed nor was told anything about receiving a bill for making a phone call to find out what type of burn cream to buy. I've called several times over 7 years and have never been charged. I'm not sure if this is a new doctor or new policy but I was never told nor sent any information in the mail. It seems like this practice is going down hill. I will be taking my children elsewhere. Very poor customer service in the office after we pay hundreds of dollars in copays and medicines and insurance. You think they would understand and not start charging people silly fees or at least tell them.

name: Tana Kae Lewis
text:
My child sees DR. Miller, she is great, patient, and provides excellent service.
Also Dr Tatum,my child was sick one weekend and she called to check on her several times. IT WAS GREATLY APPRECIATED.!!!

name: Valerie Hager
text: This office has been Exceptionally helpful and nice.  I have provided exceptional care of my severely disabled child.  I strongly recommend this office.

name: Stan Reese
text: If you have a sick child, it is easy to see the bad in things. Not here. The staff and physicians always seem concerned for you and your child. I have never had a problem - even with the insurance billing department. That is different!

name: Tiffany Hollis
text: I schedule my children’s yearly physicals a year In advance. My daughter’s birthday is in July so therefore for her yearly physical was scheduled for July. In February they called me to reschedule it because the doctor was going to be on vacation that week so it was moved out to August. Then  in May they called me yet again to reschedule it because the doctor was going to be on the sickside moving her yearly checkup out to September! Two months after the original date. Then my daughter had to get a sports physical for cheerleading and so I needed to see her doctor to get it completed before she can cheer. They told me they do not do sports physicals so  I explained to them how she was originally supposed to have her yearly check up in July but they moved it all the way out to September after rescheduling it twice. It was a hassle because she was required to see her primary doctor for physicals, but luckily after getting transferred 3 times and on the phone for almost an hour,  I finally talked to someone who worked me in sooner. Unfortunately, I have decided to go ahead and change doctors and facilities because I don’t believe that Cornerstone puts patients needs before their own. I understand doctors have to vacations too but I feel as though something could have been worked out instead of changing my daughter’s physical date TWICE.

name: Devin Webb
text:
Such a great team of pediatricians and nurses. When we moved to south Huntsville, we stayed with Cornerstone despite the long trek to Madison.

I also like that the office is segregated between regular check ups and sick kids. It's nice not getting sick when having a check up.

Some reviewers seem to dislike the staff, but I've never had any issues with them. They're busy, but not rude or arrogant. I've always gotten my appointment, records, or whatever else in a timely manner. Personally, I care less about the staff than the doctors and this place has the best.

name: Katie Boyet
text: Very happy with the care provided here. Dr. VanCleave is compassionate and thorough. He even followed up with a personal phone call to check on my son after an appointment. They got him in for an appointment same day when sick. Wait time is a bit long, but when you can get an appointment same day, that is to be expected. Took one star off for pricing, which is a little high, but worth it for the care received. Overall an great experience.

name: Renee Stanford
text:
This is the only practice we've used for our children.  While I have had courteous interaction with the doctors and nurses, other staff members have completely disappointed me.  If you don't live in close proximity, you can expect to drive there on a fairly regular basis as they do not accept documents via fax or email.  My children are involved in sports and an evaluation form must be completed by the doctor.  They will not allow the form to be faxed in to them.  That is nuts!  On top of that, of course they are going to charge you for completing the forms.

It is sad that the nurses and doctors are so great, because the staff and it's crazy policies will ruin this practice.

name: Scott Harden
text: Cornerstone has always great with our girls. They offer quality care and don't try to finish quickly and rush you out the door.

name: Casandra Ricketts
text: My family loves Cornerstone Pediatrics.  My daughter has been a patient there since the day I had her.  Dr. Cartwright came to the hospital to do her check up.  The same-day sick appointments are amazing, unfortunately we've had to make them fairly often this year with everything going around.  We have seen several different doctor's on the sick side and have loved them all.  Recently my daughter woke up on a Saturday morning with flu like symptoms.  I called the answering service and was told that the doctor would call back shortly.  Within 5 minutes I received a call back and Dr. Lawley told me that she'd see my daughter that day (on a Saturday).  Not many pediatricians would do that.  I've seen complaints about the office staff but in my 6+ years of taking my daughter there I have never had any problem with them.

name: Claire Roth
text: Dr. Johnson and the entire staff have been great and take our child's health seriously, even meeting on a Saturday morning when our guy had a high fever. Not a single complaint in nearly 2 years!

name: Jennifer Noe
text: The best staff ever! The doctors have even met me on Thanksgiving due to my son being extremely sick! They always get my kids in same day if I call and they are sick.

name: Elaine Ballew
text: I had two children fo here both until they were 18. Thankfully my kids healthy. My daughter is headed to Bama and needed her shots they stated she needed a well check up visit. She has not had one in 6 years. She has been there at least twice a year each year. Then when I explained the availability they stated they have an opening but her doctor is not available whom by the way she has not seen probably in 3 years and she has to see her doctor. Her doctor does not even know my kids as he has barely seen them.The office has become a revolving door. They care more about the number then the patient. When I stated she had to have this by a certain date the person on the phone said well since she 18 we closed out her out. Really not even a phone call or letter to let us know or try and work with us until she goes to college.

name: Wayne
text: We've been faithful patients for years.  Lovely place, better people.

name: Andy C.
text:
Cornerstone was among the top recommendations my wife and I heard when asking about a pediatrician. The office staff was arrogant and obnoxious each time we called, and in person. The pediatrician we interviewed (can't remember his name) seemed nice enough, but I could not get over the collective attitude problem of the staff. Also, we were told that they will absolutely NOT allow us to alter vaccination schedules. We chose to take our child elsewhere.
I called Cornerstone again to ask for a second opinion on a problem our newborn was having, and was told that they will only see the child if we have all the records transferred and are accepted as new patients. The receptionist hung up on me when I tried to explain that I simply wanted a second, independent opinion. That sort of behavior was downright rude.
These people seem to forget that they're competing for my money and business. I refuse to be held at their mercy and treated poorly.

name: Kyle Massengale
text: We have a great relationship with Dr. Lawley. She is attentive when we finally get in to see her. One reason for the low score is due to the worker they have at the the front window. The lady is boarder line rude as if we were intruding on her day and is not patient/parent friendly. Also, they have a very difficult policy to work with when it comes to getting in to see the doctor. They ONLY allow you to schedule appointments on the day you need the appointment. This makes is very hard to schedule your or your child's day when they need to see the doctor for sickness during the week. My daughter had poison ivy and was feeling terrible. We had to call after we had already kept her out of school only to find out they were booked. The next day I went to the office in the morning with her and was told they could not see her until later on. I asked if I could make an appointment for the next day seeing that they could see her condition, but was told no that I had to call back after 9am which would mean another day from work and her being out of school. The lady at the counter said "We do this because sometimes the child will feel better the next day and the parent would cancel the appointment." I am thinking so what? I am sure they are not lacking in patients. But she saw my child with blotches on her face and arms and hands and could see that it was not going away over night.   Therefore I was moved to post this review. I appreciate the doctor but the administration is not patient friendly and the scheduling policy is very difficult. We are now looking for another pediatrician.

name: michelle carter
text: the rudest nursing staff I have ever met. They like to argue on the phone, hang up and roll their eyes at you when you visit. don't send or receive anything via email or fax and charge for every form you request

name: AD Williams
text: the Cornerstone Peds team has always quickly and efficiently handled our needs.  Only area of improvement is to have a person actually answer phones during the lunch hour.

name: Wess Cozelos (Wess)
text: We have been with this office since we took our foster daughter there in May of 2008.  Our son was born in July and he also was seen at Cornerstone.  From the beginning it was inconsistent...sometimes awesome and other times horrible.  They gave us cases of formula for our foster daughter who had to have alimentum but then could not ever schedule our check ups on time.  They also claimed they would call us and either call the day of to say they could fit us in that day (what notice!!) or we would end up calling and complaining b/c their immunizations were past due with no call for an appointment.  Why do we have to be fit in if our babies have been patients since they were born??? That is how overbooked they are.  And I think I know which office staff the other negative post was regarding.  She is rude and borderline racist.  I am not sure what is wrong with that particular office staff but she should remove the stick from her butt if she wants to work in a children's office.  We loved Dr. Johnson, but turns out he is just as inflexible as the staff. My neighbor reported a very innappropriate comment regarding her one year old daughter by Dr. Denny a few weeks ago too.  How awful!! Needless to say after our horrible experience today we will definitely be looking for a new pediatrician. One that is more flexible and can actually make appointments for my children rather than squeezing them in as if they were less important than others.  Oh and by the way...if you need your records, you will have to wait in line for these as well. AWESOME!

name: Janine Hutton
text: Wonderful Dr all of them always helpful

name: Rihno Gaming
text: It is amazing and I like the nurses and the doctors

name: Nikole Pritchard
text: These people  NEVER answer the phone EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Seth Killough
text: rubbish

name: Jared Toone
text: We like our pediatrician here, but the clerical staff aren't as good.

name: Raqueal Hughes
text: Just spent the last month calling my 2 insurance companies about 3 claims that were improperly filed by this doctors office over a year ago. Didn't find out about the claims and outstanding balance on the account until I called to make a sick visit appointment for my 2y/o. Then received nothing but collections threats from the receptionist about the bill. Had to resolve the issue myself when the doctors office could have done it much quicker.

name: tammy
text: Always friendly at front desk. Nurse's are friendly and Dr. Crowell always takes time to talk to my child and ask him questions.

name: Lance Sprain
text:
AVOID. Told us for 3 years that my daughter didnt need tubes in her ears even with a ton of ear infections and her lack of speech development. One visit to Dr Hill and he assured us it was well past due.
Will never visit this office again, nor would I refer him.

name: Sarah Capps
text: He's a good Dr. who doesn't let momma's tell him how to treat the child. Antibiotic aren't always the solution. Sometimes you gotta stay home with a child and take care of it. That's not the Dr fault

name: Marcie Ferguson
text: The receptionist can be a bit short which can be construed as rude but generally i never have any problems. Dr. Crowell is the type to just tell you the way it is he doesn't sugar coat anything and he talks to the kids and listens to them and then takes what we say in conjunction to find a diagnosis...he might be a little rough around the edges but hes a good a dr and he always makes my kids feel like they are  being heard.

name: Ashley & Keith
text: The nurse practitioner is very good & very kind and seems to care about her patients dr there Na he DON'T believe In helping a kid get better and the lady's up front are ruide and not to friendly as the same for some of the nurse's that call u back to a room.

name: Kimberly Wigen
text: the nurses and front office ladies are the worst! I highly recommend finding a different dr's office to go to.

name: anonymous anon
text: Great doctor. Always helpful

name: Angela Hall
text: Great staff and service been with them since 2005 # Ashlyn Johnson

resp.text: Thanks so much! We love our patients and parents too! ❤️

name: Sarita Johnson
text: My children have been going to this office since birth.  Even when they no longer received Medicaid I chose to keep my children here.  There have been long wait times in the past, but during the last few years our office visits have not taken over an hour.  I think Dr. Doyle and Dr. Sheffield are excellent and we have never had any issues with either of them.  The waiting room bathroom could use a major update.

resp.text: Thank you! Yes...the lobby bathroom is overdue!

name: Tonya Cleveland
text: Dr. Dolby is a great doctor. He takes time out and explain everything to you. ( HE’S AMAZING)!!! Also, whenever I come to ABK the nurses are always friendly.

name: Natalie Nicole
text: I do not care for Dr. Doyle at this pediatrician office. He does not wash his hands the correct way with soap when seeing son. He does not try to ease my son’s nervousness by being entertaining at all. I have not been pleased with his lack of professionalism with me as a parent. He makes no initiative to personally connect with myself or my son. In addition, the wait time at this office is horrible if you make an appointment past 10am. The wait time can extend past two hours to be seen. An addition hour is needed to see the nurse and doctor. I do think the nurse staff is awesome. They keep my son’s nervousness down and try to make him feel comfortable. I would prefer for my son to see the female doctor in the office. Next time I have to take him in, I will be sure to ask that my son see the her.

name: Hailey Trough
text: We have been 7 times for the same thing and still they haven't helped at all. The doctors are rude and very disrespectful. We are looking for another doctor that exepts mrdicad

name: Vanessa Moten
text: I love this place to the fullest, from the first time ever bringing my kid's to this Dr. Office and it was 3 years ago before we moved back home. And now that we have moved back here once again, my kid's have returned here once again. I'm so grateful to have great staff to work with my kid's!!!

name: Maya Smith (MayaPapaya)
text: I have 3 children that go to this office. I have an 11 yrs old and two 5 yrs old who have all went to this office since birth. They have been overall professional and nice. I would like to see them go to a bigger office possibly thats a little bit more updated with a more updated online service and after hours phone service but other than that I can't complain.. thanks for your efforts @AllAboutKids 😊!

name: Kaycee Elmore
text: My daughter has been a patient here for years (well over 7) and we both love it. I've recommended them to several friends. They address every concern I have and never make me feel like any concern is too small (and I had many as a new mom). My daughter also has a medical condition and she has to see a specialist in Birmingham and is on several different medications. All about Kids always makes sure that all is well with that and always makes sure she can take different medicines with the ones she's on if they ever have to prescribe anything for her. They have been very patient with my daughter and I. We Love the staff. They're awesome!!!!

resp.text: Thanks!  (We get up early too! ) Lol😀

name: Lance Branchman
text: Great place love taking my kids there. The doctors and nurses are great they know what they're talking about. A+

name: La'Tanya Houston
text: Love this place!  The Doctors and NP are awesome, they take the time to thoroughly exam your children and are more than happy to answer any questions or concerns you may have.

resp.text: Thanks!  We want all children (and parents) to have a positive experience at All About Kids!  Let us know if we ever disappoint you!

name: Richmond ave
text: Both kids love Dr. Sheffield and the nurses!!!

name: Malika Murphy
text: If you cant make an appointment they charge $20 a child and plus they very slow.

resp.text: We charge a ‘no-show’ fee when you make an appointment and then do not call to cancel or change the appointment or just do not show up for the appointment you made.  All parents are notified about the fee ahead of time.  We do not like charging the fee, as we would rather be seeing your children as opposed to blocking time and then having to wait for the next scheduled patient. Our clinical team takes their time with each patient, particularly well visits that include other diagnoses.  Two children take, well..twice as long as one patient.

name: RenatraB Female
text: Not friendly and u wait too long to see anybody . And when they do call ur name u wait over a hour just to be rushed and better off going stright to the ER so unhappy 😤

resp.text: So sorry.  If you ever feel that you are being mistreated or ignored, please bring it to the office manager’s attention right away!   We want everyone to be taken care of in a prompt manner!

name: smithsarai100
text: I would like to give them more stars but I can't for the following reasons not very kid friendly and they have no changing table for baby not very organized and bathroom in lobby is gross in need of some remodeling 😥

name: mzshae334
text: Horrible customer service .. this office has given me the run around with my child for the past 4 months.. my son turned 2 in July and never received his 2 year old shots and he has been to this doctors office multiples time and for the last 4 he has had issues with his ears..we went to the er she said he had a lot of backed up fluid and it was not draining and to check with his care doctor ..his care doctor said she heads a mur mur but proceeded to send us to a specialist for his ears .. so she referred us to a specialist  and the specialist for his ears stated she didn't hear a mur mur .. so she gave us a number to call to get it check before the procedure is done ... the specialist for the mur mur said he heard nothing as well ... so I received a clearance and gave it to his primary care doctor and they reviewed it he had another doctors appointment and again they NEVER gave his shot I scheduled to have the ear specialist to contact me with a date for surgery and never heard back from the doctors office ... I called today and they tell me they can send him to the specialist because he's never gotten his 2year old shots I said well why did you guys not have to do that when we were sent out before she said "do you want to bring her is or not" I said well he is a boy .."do you wanna bring the child in or not " I said excuse me but you keep calling my son a girl and you also and getting smart when I'm only asking a question.. at this moment my mom grabs the phone and speaks she says "I don't have permission to speak with you" ... since my son has been with this doctors office it's been a run around situation with un professional workers

name: Jamelle DuBose
text: Very Pleased with the doctors and nurses I drive 50 plus miles to this office with my daughter

resp.text:
Thank you!

We appreciate your trust in us!  Always let us know how we can improve your experience.

name: Kim Smith
text: The office staff is terrible. I called and told them we'd just moved here and needed to see a new doctor. I gave her my daughter's age and she asked me to come fill out the forms for a new patient. I get there literally in five minutes and they tell me they aren't taking new patients over 4. Big waste of my time.

name: Charlene Mims
text: I have been bringing both my children since they were born 6yr old girl 3 yr old boy. First off the physicians are friendly dont get me wrong, but this past year I kept bringing my daughter in with clear liquid filled blisters in clusters on her feet and hands, told them many times that both me and my mother had suffered from these as well our whole lives as well. They insisted  it was hands foot and mouth disease. She got told that 3 times before I got tired of hearing her cry at night cause of painful itchy blisters amd cracked skin. Went around them to the emergency room where they did a skin test and turns out she along with us had Dyshidrotic eczema. Then about a month ago both my kids had high fevers for days, took them in, turns out my son had a double ear infection. They did a swab test on her and said they'd let us know if she had anything (my mom is recovering from cancer, cannot be around contagious sickness) never said anything. Next time we came back they said Hows that pneumonia clearing up, my 6 yr old had pneumonia with no meds other then otc and they didnt think it important to tell me that day. Today my son got his fingers slammed. We go to take him in and they have the doors locked. Google says they are open 9-1. Called the afterhour number and was told the same. Then when they called me back, Oh no ma'am they are closed on sat amd sun all day. Them i looked on google again and suddenly it changed. Will not be trusting them with my children anymore!

name: Miranda Lawson
text: My one star is for the few great women I encountered before removing my son from this office. Dr. Doyle should be ashamed.

name: Thomas Garrett
text: I do not know about the staff but I do know that my kids being 8 years old is a kid and now i did not know that all about kids only take 4 and under

resp.text: We take children and young adults through age 18!

name: Jameria Deramus
text: My son started going here when he was about 2 or 3 months . Every time he went there its always a different doctor so I had 2 doctors telling me 2 different things of why he was sick . The lady doctor put him on some nasal spray saying that it would help his allergies/ sinus and when I went to pick his medicine up I had a pharmacist tell me in her 19 years of working she has never seen a baby that young be on it because it drains in there throat and they don't know how to get it out so I took him back and the male doctor told me the same thing that he wasnt suppose to be on it . I  asked for a breathing treatment so that he could start taking it at home because he had been having this problem since he was born and they had no interest in giving him one . Not to mention that the pharmacist did call the doctor to make sure was it ok she said yes but the pharmacist still didnt recommed it . Every medicine they put him on seems to be a fail . I'm at the hospital now and they just told me that he needs a breathing treatment .

resp.text:
Your review failed to mention that we suggested that you come back in the next day and discuss your concerns, which you did.   Your review also did not mention that we DID issue a nebulizer to each of your children along with the medication needed for each of them.  As far as the pharmacist goes,  they can dispense from hundreds, (f not thousands) of medications to infants, children, adolescents, adults, geriatric and even 'veterinary' patients.  They fill (on average), about 50+ prescriptions per hour.   Their knowledge IS essential, but limited in 'what works' for every single patient, but their 'opinion' of what is prescribed should be taken with a grain of salt.  If they truly felt an issue, they would have called and spoken with the doctor before dispensing the medication to you.  On the other hand, pediatricians deal with a very 'small arsenal' of 'tried and true' medications that they usually prescribe from.  Each of them have their favorites.

You left our office satisfied with the outcome we provided for your children and to not mention the fact  that we resolved your concerns to your satisfaction in your review is disingenuous, at best.

If you wish to discuss this further, please stop in any weekday between 10am and 5pm and ask for the office manager.

name: Turajill
text: Drury and unprofessional place

name: Jill Dean
text: I am changing doctors you can't do walk ins if your children are sick ridiculous and never heard anything like that!!

name: Gary GORDON
text: VERY VERY GOOD

resp.text: Thanks for taking time to review us!   We like the parents, but in all honesty, we LOVE the kids!

name: Brittany Prickett
text: My WIC messed up and made it hard for me to get formula and causing me to run VERY low they were there to help and offered a free sample to get me by! I absolutely love them, their service is amazing and they love and remember small things about each individual child! HIGH RECOMMEND!!!

name: VONEISHA BEDGOOD
text: Well I have been coming here for over 15 years. I been here since Dr. Lilly and Dr. James (Dr. Jenny parents) were running things. We LOVED Dr. Lilly!!! She knew my kids names as soon as we walked in. Now the daughter is running it. I didn't have an issue with that until different nurses started working here. The staff started to change to regular. We never see Dr. Lilly any more. The bad part is they give us the option to pick which person you wanna see, I pick her but I still don't get to see her. It used to be always in and out. Not so much anymore. I hate to leave but I will be finding me and my kids a new doctors office. It's just not tge same anymore.

name: Bashan Gumm
text: The receptionist had me, her attitude is really nasty and she is very unprofessional. Besides the long wait time when you schedule an appointment (you can be waiting roughly 30mins) and even longer wait time when you walk in (i have waited over an hr before) the doctors and nurses are actually good. But the front obviously cannot handle or multitask while dealing with people. Safe to say i won’t be bringing my child back.

name: Neka Neka
text: Both my kids been coming to see Dr Alexander since birth and when she retired her daughter took over the practice.  Very sweet, loving, and cares about the children well-being. #9yearsandcounting

name: gaming Fox boy
text: My 3 kids have been coming here for years. We absolutely love Michelle kirkland she is our fav. I will admitt out of all the years we have been here we have only seen the doctor one time every other time seen the CRNP which is fine al long as its Michelle

name: Rebecca Cockrell
text: The most caring sweet kind and amazing Doctor. We love her and the compassion she has for her patients is so heartwarming.

name: D'Jarra Huffman
text: Called this office yesterday to set an appointment and was told someone will call me back later to set the appointment but never did then called today to set the appointment and was told to call back in 15 minutes if yall too busy to even set appointments I might as well find another doctor for my kids to go to

name: april mcghar-mccullough
text: I love Dr. Alexander and the NP at this office.

name: Cyndi Hebert
text: We used to love this place, but the doctor tonight has changed my mind. We were treated rudely and beneath her. She had no care in the world about my child and had her mind made up it was depression and not sickness. FYI, he has a brain disease. Smh. Hello Vanderbilt, goodbye Children's.

name: Mindy Tobin
text: This is not a first come first serve hospital..this is a sickest child goes first hospital..thank god..Remembering that time is of the essence in the event of an emergency while you wait is a must.sometimes the sickest baby doesnt look ill at all..oh and..its christmas time !!

name: pedro martinez
text: We have been to many urgent care facilities over the years, but tonight was another level. We had to go the children's. I can not tell you what it meant to us. From the moment we walked in the door, things were different. This is the kind of medical care I heard my mom talk about in the 50's, genuine concern and compassion. We had been to 2 different urgent cares and had gotten the run around, before we finally decided, we need to go downtown to children's. The urgent care facilities' demeanor was negative and "be thankful for what you get". Children's was different. Compassion and loving urgency to get this child some comfort was so obvious. My child immediately relaxed and become a willing patient. In short, he felt their love. Man, that makes a huge difference! Please don't stop being the compassionate and loving medical providers that you are, it makes oceans of difference.

name: Patty Griffith
text: Children’s of Alabama Emergency Room is a place where they will put your mind at ease. Your child or children are in the best care. I have taken my son more than once and never felt so reassured that he would be taken care of like he was one of their children. You can valet your car to avoid the hassle between 16th and 17th street. A great service to make the emergency room trip run smoothly.

name: Drew Mack
text: I am a patient that has had back issues going on for 4 months without a diagnosis.   I went into the ER because I had no way to stop my pain.  I entered the ER around 8:00pm.   I had a very high BP and pain level.   I got called back about 8:30pm and was admitted into the hospital for 5 days.  Thank you Children’s for all of your help.  I will fight through this.

name: McDonald *
text: Wow, ER doctors are so good now they can diagnose a toddler that has had 3 days of temp (currently 104) just by looking at them. NO testing required!!

name: Jack R
text: Eh, it was decent! it took forever for doctors to come, but not bad at all

name: G G
text: The wait was long but the quality of care was worth it.

name: sothonn harbison
text: Don't waste your time- you won't get seen till hours and hours later. By then I could have had my regular pediatrician see my baby. Go to the ER for these signs they say. Very high fever is just another number. No concerns for the vomiting, rapid breathing, hard to breath, seizures, baby turning purple and temperature keeps rising to alarming levels even after medicine, cold rag and bath. And then to be release with a "virus"? Can they be anymore vague?

name: Buddy Skinner
text: The staff, the valet parking make for a pleasant atmosphere upon our arrival at Children’s of AL. ER. The nurses and doctors were all well trained, professional, and also friendly to our child/us.  They listened to him explain his symptoms. Then everything they were doing to treat his illness and get him stabilized. Very comforting knowing such a wonderful, first class facility is located so close to our home. Birmingham is Blessed to have Children’s of AL hospital.

name: Aris Garcia
text: Wonderful staff, they treated my son like he was the only patient...more than a hospital a 5 starts hotel.

name: Alan Thornton
text: My 4 year old nephew waited 4 hours with a neck injury that was hurting him so bad he was shaking. After the 4 hour wait we asked how much longer it would be and was told another 4-5 hours. Meanwhile a guy gets brought in by police in handcuffs cause he got bit by the k9 in the hand trying to run away comes in an hour after us and he got taken straight back. We ended up taking him to another er the next day and when they xray him he had an out of place vertebrae in his neck . But they take in a criminal first... PEICE OF TRASH HOSPITAL

name: shelia wade
text: They quick and they take good care of  Jaylen Bailey when he arrive.

name: Brent Elrod
text: Great place!  They’ve done a lot to help our child.

name: Cristen Greathouse
text: I was sent to children's to get a ct scan after a doctor's x-ray showed something abnormal. My daughter was run a low fever and her white blood cells count was high and she had chest pain a hard time taking a deep breath. When we arrived everything was quick and easy they even give her  medicine to help with the fever . Then we got put in a room the resident doctor can in to tell us that they wasn't doing a ct scan but another x-ray.  I was a little  Confused but ok at 6:30 they took her back for another x-ray she got back at 6:35 . Then the waiting game was on we wanted for a hour for them to tell us she was fine and could go home,but if she started running a fever and having a harder time breathing to bring her back . Then I was really confused.. She was running a fever when we came in and they never  Explained why her white blood cell count was up. But she was fine !! So I guess your telling me my 14yr is making up the chest pain shortness of breath and fever..

name: Ashna S.
text: Love love love this place. The staff are amazing, friendly, gentle, and very caring. The wait can be pretty irritating when your baby is hurting but once they get you back in a room it’s a breeze from there. I had originally taken my daughter to St Vincent’s in Pell City because her doctor had told me to take her there. They were no help. Children’s will always save the day. Thanks so much Children’s hospital.

name: Lythea Brown
text: Worse place I have ever been too! I would not recommend coming here and I want even here for me or my cold I was a friend's driver. But the wait was ridiculous and the front nurses were rude and not helpful and withheld information.

name: Aida Talley
text: The building is beautiful. I did not like the fact that there was a metal detector in a children's hospital. The staff was very nice but we waited for an hour for my daughter to get a room after coming in ambulance then when she was placed in a room we waited two hours and no one every came. One RN said she didn't know we were even in the room. My daughter fainted without warning at a subway while coming from our family vac. She was unconscious shortly but conscious when I arrived. We left the hospital.

name: craig wooden
text: Top notch staff and physicians. Brought my daughter to the ER and had no wait. We went straight to a room and a doctor was in within a few minutes. Everyone was nice and helpful. I would highly recommend Childrens of Alabama.

name: Gus E
text: Our son was transferred here from another hospital bc they couldn’t keep an IV in.  1st try at Children’s, and they get the IV started. Outstanding team.  kudos to all the staff! Very loving and sincere. Simply the best.

name: Kunqi “No longer well rested”
text: Ok i guess. Its really long and the staffs looks like they don't care about their job anymore. I have crohns disease and most of time every time i go to the hospital, they just.. Look at you with dull eyes. Warning the staffs can immediately make you feel unwelcome

name: Holly Fitz
text: 1st time visit to Children's ER around 5pm for high fever and eye swelling following surgery that same morning at 7am. Let me stress to you the shock at walking into this place. When you arrive you hand over your bags to security to be searched and walk through a medical detector. Upon walking in i appalled. The place was disgusting. The floors and chairs were smeared in god knows what and their wasn't a hand sanitizer station visible in the place.  Upon intake my child was given a large dose of Tylenol (even though i had just given him some 2 hours before) the dose was 3.75 ml even though our sheet from pediatrician says weight gets 2.5ml. and he was given a dose of Benadryl and we were sent back to waiting room. After an hour or so we were taken to a room where the billing representative came immediately to collect my 100 copay and then an hour later we saw a resident who snottily corrected me when i called him a nurse. He asked some questions looked him over and left. I didn't see anyone again for hours. I was by myself, my child is an infant and i needed to use the bathroom. the only one was in the hall. The bed had no rails to leave my baby in, there was no nurse visible or that answered the call button to assist and the bathroom had no table to lay him on so i could use the bathroom. After a few hours the doctor comes in with a nurse and informs me that my child is allergic to tape (where they taped his eyes down for surgery that morning) and he has sensitive skin. And that they were going to give him a dose of Benadryl to help the swelling. I said NO you just gave him Benadryl on intake and a very large dose of Tylenol. They were like oh we did? Sorry.. I pointed out that the Benadryl did not help and his eye is looking progressively worse and that if he was allergic to tape wouldn't both eyes be like this?  They informed me they weren't going to do anything or run any tests and to follow-up with regular doctor tomorrow. They would however do a flu test to appease me. I know he doesn't have the flu and after 30 minutes i paged the nurse to ask if we can go home and have the flu results called to doctor the next morning? They said they will tell the nurse and send her in to talk to us. Never showed up. Flash forward another hour and 45 minutes. Flu negative and we can finally go home. Vitals and temp never checked since intake and no bloodwork drawn. Nothing. The next morning my child breaks out in the roseola rash. Thanks for nothing Children's. I'm glad my child wasn't having post-surgery infection. If my baby needs to go back to ER. We'll be going to Grandview.

name: HairByTammy T
text: Top-notch facility & staff! Courteous & very thorough! We appreciate the care my son received tonight!

name: Jennifer Hutchings
text: Just want to let you all know that ur emergency staff last night was horrible...i brought my daughter in cause she hit the door frame and had 2 goose eggs on her head and immediately started throwing up. We also brought it to their attention that she was hurting in her private area. They had us there for 2 hrs and didnt do anything but give her some Motrin. When they said that they weren't going to do a ct scan due to radiation we thought ok well we will be going home in a minute then. They kept us there for 2 hrs with them seeing that she was in pain in her private area and they wouldnt do anything but tell us to get some diaper rash cream. They could have given her something for some relief and was going to keep us for 2 more hrs to watch her for the head condition when it was clear that she was fine with that.  I also told them that she is a symptomatic hemophilia carrier and they did absolutely nothing for her. I had to finally just say let us go so we can go get her something to help with the pain. I had to google what i needed to get for her and leave there and go by CVS in the middle of the night when they could have given her something there. I haven't had many problems from children's before but last night was the 2nd worst experience I've had there. Their job is to make these kids feel better not ignore the symptoms. I could have given Motrin at the house and avoided the hr s that I spent up there FOR ABSOLUTELY NOTHING

name: Demyla Matthewjr
text: My son years old and he sick throwing up bleeding nose been here since 8 still n the waiting room a 11 really sad

name: Shannon S Crenshaw
text: Typically we have good service.  Today I have been waiting for 2 plus hours waiting to be seen by the doctor.  I was told due to my child being sicker then other patients it would take longer.  Not sure of that logic.  Not happy, Life with insurance in America.

name: Carrie Harden
text: My 10 yr old daughter died after 42 days on ECMO. We were told in front of dozens of witnesses there just wasn't nothing left they could do yet when we get her med rec it shows they "resuscitative measures were deemed medically futile although family did not explicitly withdraw care" then at 12pm her pump was reduced to 1 which wasn't life sustaining and no further vitals or any other records were logged after 12pm but she didn't die until 1:24pm. Also none of her meds were given except sedation! Why lie? If she was beyond saving then why lie to our faces?

name: raven prince
text: This visit wasn't so great since the  nurse forgot to give me a sample cup for my daughter which postponed our time by an hour since we had to wait for her to use the bathroom again. Dr. Childress is Amazing! This is my second encounter with him and he has been very nice to us. I was excited when I saw the free valet service but upon leaving they lost a patients vehicle! She had her ticket and they brought her another persons keys asking if they were hers and what type of vehicle was it. It took exactly 10mins for them to bring my vehicle and they were still trying to figure out where the lady Durango was. I would've loved to give them 5 stars but sadly this visit wasn't that great.

name: Jenna Walden
text: I brought my 3 year old in due to a fall. Once we arrived, she started vomiting and couldn't stay conscious. The staff could care less. I walked out to the nurses station to find someone to help my daughter and I was told my nurse was giving someone an IV they would get her to my room. After waiting 2 hours, a lady walks in the room to register us and I still had not seen the nurse or a dr. At that point I got up and walked out with my child and went to another ER where they saw her promptly and ran test. I will NEVER take any of my kids to children's hospital again. Very poor service and you will never see a real doc just a "nurse practioner" if one ever makes it around to your room.

name: Ryan Jones
text: Best emergency department in the state! The care you get here is top notch.

name: Poe Edgar
text: We are still sitting in the ER waiting  room after 2 and a half hours. We did get called back but only to be turned around because "we had to give your room to someone else". If you come bring a lunch and have a friend or family member  on reserve so you can rotate.  We will probably still be here waiting when you arrive.

name: Aries Gates
text: Date of Service: 11/15/2016 @9:15pm Room 16 in E.R. I have had the worst experience in my Life! My son has been having Migraines for the last 8 years & he is 12 yrs old. When you have a child that suffers from this type of pain it hurts my Heart that Dr.Anna White would come & ask questions. Conversation: Dr. Anna White    Kameron what's hurting on you? Kameron replies my head is hurting really bad & my stomach. Dr. Anna White asked: How long has your head been hurting & Kameron replied off & on since last night but my stomach started today. Dr. Anna White then asked have he had any bowel movements & Kameron replied: he did earlier today & it was normal. Dr.Anna White asked if he has eaten anything today & Kameron advised he ate a couple hours ago. Dr. Anna White asked what did he eat? Kameron told her  he had Mash Potatoes, Pork Chop, & Corn( Let me add it was the smallest portion of food ever) but anyway Dr. Anna White then goes in to say this is a Non-Emergency Visit because if he tolerated a Meal it's not an Emergency! My response: it's an Emergency  to me because my Son never complains unless he is really sick & if he tells me he needs to go to the Dr. I'm going to bring him. Dr. Anna White then goes on to tell me that they are just counseling patients on Non-Emergency visits, I then cut her off in mid sentence & told her you don't have to help him we will leave because I felt she has had a long day & is now taking it out on us because she feels it's not an Emergency. My son has been at this ER dozens of times & we have never been treated this way. I don't want to ever in my Life step back into this ER as long as I'm breathing because I work in Healthcare as well & our Mission is to always make sure the patient is taken care of. Nurse was Great! Check-in Great! Wait was Ok! The Escort to the room was Great with a Smile! The Patient Coordinator was Great! Dr. Anna White is Horrible & I will write & call Patient Advocate to complain.

name: Amber Ramsey
text: Been sitting in the emergency room for almost three hours and we still don't know what's wrong with our daughter. Is the the doctor even here?

name: Stephanie McDaniel
text: Absolute nightmare. Wait was 4 hrs in waiting room, was back in our room another 8 hrs. Absolutely absurd to be an emergency room. And still no answers!

name: Jaber Alnajar
text: Minimum 6 hours that too much

name: Asia Lawson
text: Great and  caring service very loving faculty

name: Erica Melville
text: Horrible service, have been waiting for hours. Was kind of ghetto and overall a bad experience.

name: Courtney Brianna
text: Came here tonight because my 3 week old baby was sick and was told by her pediatrician to go to the ER if any worse.  That’s exactly what we did and we were told by the front desk staff that it would be another 5-6 hour wait IF things didn’t “change.”  We had already waited 3 and a half hours and decided to leave.  This used to be a great hospital but it’s going downhill quick.  I hope someone is capable of building another pediatric hospital in Alabama one day.  It will be a cold day in hell for me to come back.

name: alyssa hines
text: i am a paicent there the nurses are really nice

name: Mrs Tipps
text: Three different times took my daughter in to see Dr. Melvin and she was diagnosed with "fussy baby", and all three times took her to Dr. Hammond in Florence after and she had an ear infection after all. Ladies at the front desk and in the finance department are very rude and are not hospitable. I will NOT take either of my daughters there again.

name: carolyn conner
text: So i moved to Alabama june of 18. It took them till jan of 19 to get my kids in and get their Records. I called both my nc dr and the never received anything. I called then it was literally back and forth patiently wait for them to do their job. I then moved back to nc of February of 19 because i got sick of them not wanting to send my kids where they needed to be (my oldest has speech issues). Well my now new nc dr has sent them request 4 times for my kids records... They sent my oldest but not my youngest. MY 1 YR OLD IS NOW 5 ROUNDS OF SHOTS BEHIND BECAUSE THEY REFUSE TO SEND RECORDS OR REQUEST RECORDS. MY NC DR CANT EVEN LOOK AT HIM TILL THEY SEND THEM... If my kid gets sick i would have to take him to the er which has been on a flu restriction for the last month. So glad he hasnt gotten sick but like i really wanna take a 1 yr old in for an ear infection only to turn around and get the flu? No.... And when i call to see whats taking so long to why they havent sent them to nc its because "we legally dont have to send them at all". DO YALLS DAMN JOB.

name: Carmilla Evans
text: They are great. The nurses are very nice and they are down to earth. The majority of them have children so they can relate to the sickness and others that parents deal with on a day to day basis. I love dr. Melvin and his squad.

name: justinwaddle1

name: BRIAN JOHNSON
text:
I’m a former United Methodist Pastor out of Mobile, Al. I served as Senior Pastor at Coden.
My little girl is 5 now. She has always received great care at this facility. All the doctors are great and show  they genuinely  care for the children as well as the parents.

name: Haley Brunson
text: The doctor himself was great. The staff was not. There was a bill that I was unaware of. Luckily I checked my credit and saw that it had been sent to collections. I called to pay it immediately and asked what happened. They said the bill had been sent back to them. I’m unsure why they didn’t call me and ask me my new address instead of just sending the bill to collections. I had even visited the office since the bill date and was never made aware of anything. So just beware. If you have a bill and it gets sent back to them for whatever reason, instead of trying to resolve by a simple phone call (or even bringing it up when you go in), they’ll send your bill straight to collections and not say a word to you about it. They’re very money motivated, lazy, and not personable at all. I’m never one to leave reviews but to be so willing to mess up someone’s credit without even a phone call doesn’t sit right with me.

name: Rebecca Seitz
text: LOVE Dr. Harrell! I’m only giving 3 stars because I feel like the staff up front isn’t friendly AT ALL. Usually it’s one word answers to my questions that are very short and dry. Every time I call to make an appointment they make me feel like a bother. We have been forgotten in the waiting room 3 times in our 5 years which doesn’t sound too bad but when you are a new mom with a screaming baby it’s frustrating. The last time it happened was about a year ago when my son needed a flu shot. They told us we didn’t need an appointment but I knew to expect some wait time but about an hour after I “checked in” I went up to the desk to be told they were sorry and we were looked over. Again, LOVE our pediatrician but after hearing other friends experiences with their pediatrician and how wonderful and nice the staff is where they go I find myself wanting to change.

resp.text: We’re sorry you feel your experience at Infirmary Pediatrics was unsatisfactory. If you are open to discussing the matter further, please email us at feedback@infirmaryhealth.org with the patients name and your phone number so we can reach out to you personally.

name: Katelin Howell
text: Dr. Wells is a good doctor. However the staff at the front has zero communication skills and when you bring this to their attention it is the patients fault. I called to rescheduled my child an appointment for the 12th that was originally the 19th. My mom had taken him to his previous app and she had to take him to this one as well. Then they turn her away (after telling her there wasn’t an appointment but they would see him) because it was to early after his last appointment to get shots. Then when I call she tells me I was told last time I came in that he wouldn’t be able to come before the 15th.  One, I was not or I wouldn’t have called to reschedule Two, even if I was when I called to reschedule why wasn’t I told them that it wasn’t a possibility. Then she also tried putting me on hold to see if I would hang up which again was rude. They also never sent me anything telling me they were beginning to take 12 month appointments and up when they canceled my child’s 12 month appointment due to COVID. I also was never notified that my child needed a 15 month appointment or that I missed it. They only sent me a letter after I scheduled an appointment for catch up that they planned on stopping him as a patient.

name: Niki McMullen
text: I absolutely love infirmary pediatrics. As a new mom I always felt inclined to take my daughter to the doctor whenever I felt as though she wasn’t feeling well and I never once was made to feel about bringing her in. Dr. Harrell is incredible and I recommend him to everyone! He never makes me feel dumb for asking questions and he is so sweet with my daughter. Dr. Wells is just as pleasant! The staff is always extremely friendly and I’ve never waited over 10 minutes in the waiting room. Scheduling appointments is quick and easy.

name: Kayla Parazine
text: We LOVE Infirmary Pediatrics! We have been going there for almost two years with our 21 month and 6 month old. We use Dr Harrell and could not be more satisfied! He is extremely loving, sincere and thorough. I always leave feeling confident that my children were given the best care possible by him. One of his nurses is Nicole and she is incredible! Always so kind to us and does not forget a face. Rachel Hill at the front office has always taken great care of us! The facility is so clean and has  a great atmosphere because all of the staff are more than amazing. We have had to see a couple of the other doctors when Dr Harrell wasn’t on call and we have been satisfied with them as well! You can not go wrong at Infirmary Pediatrics! They are the best!!

name: Victoria Patrick
text: We love dr Harrell. Our 2 year old has seen him since birth as well as our 7 month old. He is the kindest doctor. He’s very attentive and doesn’t treat you like you don’t know what you’re talking about. He takes his time and has an amazing bedside manner. We’ve seen the other doctors as well and they’re all great. Also the nurses and rest of the staff are awesome. The ladies in the front are always so sweet and helpful and get you right in the day you call.

name: Monique Grayson
text: The best doctor's office for kids. You can see and feel their love for what they do and for your kids! They have lots of love and compassion, each time you go there! They get you in and out, with some of the best doctor's Dr. Gardner,  Dr. Wells,  Dr. Harold, and Dr. Johnson. Dr. Gardner is my son's Isaac doctor but when she is out, my son has had the pleasure of see each of these amazing doctor's and they are all awesome and compassion in their own rights. But I would have to say Dr. Gardner and her nurse Jodi are our favorite! My second choice would be Dr. Nina Johnson. They are all AWESOME doctor's with great employees that make you feel welcome each time you come to visit!

name: Brittnay Massingill
text: We love Infirmary Pediatrics! Our son sees Dr. Harrell and we love that he makes you feel relaxed and not rushed. He’s very knowledgeable and great with our son. We’ve also seen Dr. Gardner after hours and was very pleased with that visit as well. I would recommend this office any time!

name: Brandy Weindorf
text: Dr. Ford as we call her...Dr.Johnson is the best hands down pediatrician around. We live in Baldwin County and travel to Mobile just to see her. My daughter has a few respiratory issues and Dr. Ford knows my daughter and knows just how to treat her. It’s awesome when you walk in and she doesn’t even have to look at the computer to remember medical history. I highly recommend ALL of the physicians at this practice!!!!!

name: WyConda Finney
text: I absolutely love Infirmary Pediatrics. The entire staff is so courteos and professional. They are always well organized and timely. I always feel I get the necessary attention no matter the situation. My daughter's pediatrician, Dr. Nina Ford Johnson, is an absolute gem. Her bright smile and warm personality puts you at ease. She is very thorough and attentive to your child's needs. Dr. Gardner is no different. We've gone to her twice for emergency visits.  It's reassuring to know you get the same quality service with someone who isn't your "assigned physician." I highly recommend this office personally and to anyone looking for pediatric services.

name: Amber Millender
text: I love Rachel at Infirmary Pediatrics! She is an asset to the staff. She always helps me with all my needs promptly! She makes me feel like my needs are personal for her. She always answers the telephones with a smile. She knows my children and I by name. I'm happy to call the company my children's medical home!

name: Morgan White
text:
Infirmary Pediatrics is the best around town.  We have been with them in between all of their transitions.   Dr. Wells is the most thorough physician we have ever had.  She treats us all like family.   All of her nurses are amazing and very patient with my LOUD children.   Rachel in the front is always very welcoming.  I also have to brag on Dr. Johnson.  She takes care of us when we have unexpected visits.   I request her if Dr. Wells is not present.   Her personality is outstanding.  Very compassionate about her job.
I can not say enough wonderful things about this practice..

name: Megan Bodiford
text: Absolutely love Infirmary Pediatrics they are great with my son. He has seen almost every doctor in there and they have been very helpful. We love Dr. Harrell he is the sweetest. I also want to mention Rachel Hill she is so very helpful with getting appointments set up for me etc. very professional.

name: Stefany Gant
text: I absolutely love everyone here.  My pediatrician,  Dr. Nina Ford-Johnson is the best there is.  Raising a micro-preemie as a first time mom is difficult, but Dr. Johnson encouraged me and lifted me up and continues to do so.  She is an excellent physician and my son's health is proof of it.

name: Emily Mackey
text:
We rely heavily on reviews to choose different providers, and this time did not disappoint! We chose Dr. Nina Ford Johnson as our 4 year old son's pediatrician and soon to be our newborn daughter as well. Dr. Johnson and her nurse were both incredibly warm, friendly, and knowledgeable. They gave all the time we could ask for to address new patient concerns and provide top quality care for a well child visit. Above all, both doctor and nurse have EXCELLENT bedside manner and made a checkup/vaccination a fun experience for our little boy. The practice overall is current on all AAP and CDC/WHO guidelines, is immaculately clean without carrying that awful hospital disinfectant odor, and is even decorated in a manner that is educational for small children but not overstimulating. Front desk staff are friendly, helpful, and courteous. Water fountains and restrooms are quite clean (even to a neat freak like me), and separate wait areas are offered (and enforced in a nice way) for sick visits, well visits, and even a newborn waiting area.
Overall we could not be more pleased with our experience, and it seemed obvious to both myself and my husband that Dr. Johnson followed a true calling to become a fantastic pediatrician. If you are new to town and still learning how to make the right choices for your children's care- choose Infirmary Pediatrics! This is the third provider we have tried in as many years (first Providence Family, then USA Pediatrics) and it seems third time really is the charm! We can't wait for Dr. Johnson and the staff to love on and work with our daughter as well- and I'm due tomorrow.

name: Brittney Williams
text: Horrible staff!! Do not go there!! I called for an walk in appointment my child had a temp of 102.9. The lady told me they were at lunch won’t be able to be seen until 2:15 I told her so my child’s temp doesn’t matter she laughed and said yes but they won’t be back to see her until that time! I went in anyways asked to speak to a manager during my 60 minutes of waiting!! Got to the back her manager came in and told me basically she would talk to her and that sometimes she makes faces and laugh also!! Don’t play with me I will RIP YOUR FACE OFF!! They phone girls name was ANNA KATE and her manager has a mole over her eye didn’t get her name I think it’s Louise! Will be going somewhere else

name: Angela Walker
text: Dr. Wells and her team have been amazing. Would definitely recommend this group of Pediatricians. Very helpful to first time moms. They walked us through step by step with new patient enrollment and were very friendly and kind. Also, the facility is in a great and clean condition.

text:
This facility has clinicians that really care about the patient and focus carefully on each need.  They take the time to actually listen, not rushing along.  Justin Jessee is the highlight of my children’s visit—he is adept in interacting with kids.

The billing department is great also, always answering my questions in a timely manner.

I highly recommend their services.

name: Taylor Allen
text: Dr. Johnson is my 10 month old’s primary physician, but we’ve also visited Dr. Wells. Both are amazing. Dr. Johnson is fantastic with children. She’s patient, thorough, and will answer any silly question you may have. She’s helped me tremendously on this journey as a new mother and has reassured me countless times that I’m doing fine. Dr. Johnson is great!

text: I love thisnoffice! We just started going here a couple months ago, and I couldn’t be happier. Dr.Nina Ford Johnson is amazing. Her voice is so calming and she has a way about her that helps the kids and the moms feel better about being at the doctor.

as for schedualing, I have had two recent apointment that I have schedualed prior to the appointment and when I arrive. I am told that my child does not have an appointment that  day. even though it was written down by the receptionist.

text:
We have 5 kids that see Dr. Gardner and she is awesome! She’s won't stop until she gets to the bottom of what is ailing your little one. Jody is her nurse and she is wonderful! Our 2nd son was hospitalized a couple of years ago for 6 days and Dr. Gardner came and saw him everyday, and she was very hands on with determining what was going on with him.

text: We love Eastern Shore Children’s Clinic at Spanish Fort. We moved here about 3 years ago and saw Ashley Penn for most of our visits.
