name: Johnisha Collins
text:
I took my son to the Urgent Care in Trussville. Upon arrival there was no one at the front desk. I had to ring the bell and wait several minutes until I actually saw a worker. Once a worker finally appeared she asked us to sign in and have a sit. She came back and got us checked in. We waited to be called back. Once we were  called back we sat in the exam room for over an hour. No one ever came back to check on us. I stuck my head out the door to see the nurse/front desk receptionist had left to get what look like a prescription & was just returning. She told us the physician would be in shortly, but that never happened. We ended up leaving without being seen. Common courtesy is everything. If a patient has been waiting for awhile it doesn't hurt to check in on them from time time. It helps with letting them know they haven't been forgotten.
Signed,
A disappointed mom

resp.text: We’re sorry to hear that you had a less than positive experience during your last visit to our Trussville location, Johnisha. Our team strives to provide quality urgent pediatric care across all of our clinics and we take patient feedback very seriously. We will be sure to look into this matter and talk with our team to ensure this does not occur again. A member of our team will reach out to you shortly to better understand your experience. Please feel free to call us at (205) 848-2273 if you have any additional feedback and we hope you will still consider Urgent Care for Children for future needs.

name: Rebekah Hunter
text: Fast, easy and great care taken to answer all of my questions. I highly recommend them for sick little ones, especially when you need weekend assistance.

resp.text: Thanks for the review! We're happy to hear you had a positive experience during your visit - thank you for choosing Urgent Care for Children!

name: Toni Fikes
text: Our little one got home from daycare and was just absolutely miserable with a fever so i took her up to Children Urgent Care. The ability to make an appointment online was wonderful. The wait time was very very short. We saw Dr. Arora and I cannot say enough wonderful things about her. She came in and recognized my daughter was about to get upset and she proceeded to sing to her to keep her calm. Dr. Arora went about and beyond when it came to getting to the bottom of my daughter's misery and ultimately was able to provide us with the diagnosis of RSV. Dr. Arora sat down with me and explained the virus and what to do to care for my daughter. She made me feel comfortable and i left confident in my daughter's recovery process. Dr. Arora has a bedside manner that far exceeds expectations and is absolutely wonderful. Thank you!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review, Toni! We're happy to hear that you had such a great experience with the team here at UCC. Thanks for trusting Urgent Care for Children!

text: Never again. My kid busted his head wide open this morning. They open at 10...just spent 20 minutes in the parking lot because no one had a key to get in. Ended up going to another doctor (AFC) and we went straight in to the doctor. Who has an urgent care that opens that late anyway? Not very urgent if you ask me.

resp.text:
Hi Tim,
We are sorry to hear that you did not have a positive experience during your visit to our Birmingham clinic. We had an unexpected situation leading to this inconvenience to our customers. Our team strives to provide quality care every time and takes this feedback very seriously. We will share this information with our team and work to ensure this does not happen again in the future. Please feel free to call us at (205) 848-2273 to provide any additional feedback you may have.

LC,

At Urgent Care for Children, we strive to provide quality care with less waiting for every family we serve. When we fail to deliver this promise, we work diligently to identify the problems at hand and create a solution. On behalf of everyone at UC4C, I want to apologize for your experience and wait. We will be using your feedback to make positive changes to ensure the wait time stays at a minimum. Thank you for your feedback!

name: Anne Kimbrough
text:
Love Dr. Bragg!
She is one of the best primary care physicians I've ever had as a patient. As a nurse for over 38 years, I really appreciate  the fact that she listens to me as not only a professional but as a patient. She is readily accessible on our portal, listens and responds within a very reasonable  time. Can't ask for more!

name: Elizabeth Larsen
text: I was a patient of nurse practitioner Shannon’s when she first started there some years ago. I’ve since moved out of Birmingham to the Huntsville area and have truly considered making the two hour drive down to Leeds whenever needed so I could continue to be one of Shannon’s patients! I haven’t been able to find a family provider as good as her since!

name: Renan Little
text: I drive the long distance to Leeds when labs are needed. The facility is extremely efficient, the building immaculate, and the staff very friendly.

name: Carol Lee
text: I saw Dr. Sarah Bragg as a new patient.  She was so nice, thorough, and listened to all my issues.  She made suggestions with which I agreed.  When I was really sick and out of town she had a telehealth appointment with me and solved all my issues.  I highly recommend her.  She is the tops!

name: Akilih Haley
text: Dr Bragg and Nurse Christina were very professional, nice and understanding of my needs and concerns as a new patient. I'm happy to entrust my health to Dr Bragg and her staff.

name: Ashlee Green
text: Even though I was little bit late for my appointment I was screened and went right to the back. Every person I interacted with was very nice. Love the team of Dr Amy Boone and Rhonda. Clinic was very clean as I could tell that they take COVID-19 precautions seriously.

name: David Abernathy
text: Horrible dr. And staff is even worse.  Extremely rude and poor patient care.  Extremely long wait times.

name: Mili Johnson
text: Everyone was very friendly.Although my husband couldn’t stay with me they made me feel so much support and security here. I appreciate the staff being friendly and Accommodating.

name: Eric Dunklin
text: Wonderful clinic very accommodating and convenient best thing to  have it so close so you don't have to fight that downtown traffic or lines down their that seem to never end and the exhaustion of all that walking Love this clinic .

name: Donna Shrewsbury
text:
I recently saw Dr. Sarah Braggs. She is absolutely precious! She was very attentive to me. She also was very thorough. I went to her as a new patient and left feeling like I had known her for years! I highly recommend her!

Also, my son and husband see Dr. Russell. He is an amazing doctor!

Great place! Great team!

name: Traci Miller
text: I have not had an overall physical in years and decided I needed to have one. I had to wait a couple of months to get in to be seen and now I know why! My appointment was at 10 am. Since I was a new patient I had a couple of short forms to complete even though I was able to complete new patient paperwork online. I had barely finished and was called back to be seen. Dr. Carlie Stein was my doctor and she was fabulous! She took time to ask me questions about concerns I may have, answered all my questions and didn't seem rushed at all! She recommended tests I may want to have done since it had been a while since I had a physical. I needed to have a mammogram done as well as a tetanus shot and blood work for tests. I was out of their door by 11:20!! And while everyone made sure to move through what had to be done efficiently and quickly, I did not feel rushed and or that they didn't answer my questions. I recommended this office to anyone that is looking for a primary care doctor!

name: Jacinda Dees
text: No wait time. Everyone was nice, polite, and caring. The needs of the patient are a top priority for them.

name: Christina Jones
text: Convenient but missing Physician/patient relationship focus. My family started coming to this location as soon as the paint dried on the walls. We found Dr. Russell to be a wonderful physician with excellent bedside manner. Unfortunately we never get to see "Our" doctor. In the years we have been patients of Dr. Russell we have seen the Nurse Practitioner 9 times out of 10. Though we have no complaints on the Nurse Practitioner we had hoped to establish a strong lasting relationship with Dr. Russell. After talking with several friends who use this practice, they all have very similar experiences. If you are not concerned with long term care from a single doctor then this practice is amazing. We just want a doctor for life, if possible.

name: A Hall
text: This clinic is top notch. Dr. Russell has been our family doctor for several years when he was at UAB Moody.  I would recommend him and his staff to anyone.

name: Nancy Cork
text: I am sure no one wants to go through diagnostic tests but if you have to, this is the place to go! As a retired Nurse Practitioner, I cannot say enough wonderful things about the staff I interacted with their professionalism. I was scheduled for 3 tests and they realized I had another one at the end of the month at Kirklin. They asked if I wanted to do that one today as well! I had 4 tests, 3 technicians, and I was done in an hour. Everyone was super kind and great at explaining what was going to happen. I cannot recommend using this Diagnostic Center enough.

name: Tracie Smith
text: I am writing this as I leave the UAB Leeds radiology clinic.  This was my first closed MRI experience.  I have been apprehensive about it.  Thank you so much to the professional, caring staff at UAB Leeds. Ariel, Ashley, and James, thank you so much for making my experience a positive one.  I highly recommend this facility and staff.

name: SANDRA MARSHALL
text: I have been with UAB and Dr. Russell for 7 years. I am very pleased with Dr. Russell but very displeased with the lab. They have made some changes, and I have been very displeased. Be prepared for the lab to give you an inaccurate result, only to call you back with an accurate result much later (which runs up the cost). My little boy had strep for over 2 weeks due to a break in communication from the lab. Very unacceptable! This has happened several times.

name: Jayy TV
text: Such a great experience when I went there, it doesn't even feel like a doctors office you just feel welcomed and invited. I highly recommend seeing the nurse practitioner Shannon

name: Vanessa Daniel Menu
text: I had to visit the Radiology Clinic  at UAB Leeds Clinic.  I would like to say that this was the best experience that i have encounterd in a long time from the entire staff.  They were all friendly  ànd professional.  I especially  want .mention Carla who performed  the Ultrasound and Amy who performed the X-Rays.  If UAB teach a class on  professionalism  and customer service, they should ask both of them to demonstrate how it"s done.  Thanks  to all of the staff.

name: Priscilla Wadsworth
text: Don't see the gynecologist here! She won't listen to your concerns, and didn't even know what hormone was in Plan B (named a completely different one)!

name: LeeAnn Miller
text: Both my husband and I switched to Dr. Stein for Primary care at UAB Leeds and she assured us when we were sick they would work us in.  My husband has been turned away twice and myself once.

name: Stephen Mcrae
text: Great service fro staff

name: Danny Bowen
text: Really helpful and professional staff . If you don't like it here go to DCH in Tuscaloosa and you'll be very pleased with UAB medicine

name: Yazmin Flores
text: I set up an appointment with no issues only to get a call a day later that they couldn't fufill it because they had a scheduling issue and weren't aware of the date the doctor would actually be in the office. I was then given an appointment to meet with a nurse practioner which was also cancelled because they insisted that I had to meet with a doctor first so I made another appointment. This third appointment was made for a date 20 days later than what I had originally agreed to so I was already being inconvenienced by this delay, then today I got a phone call stating that my  appointment was yet again being cancelled with no explanation. This is now beyond ridiculous and I will be calling to be removed from their system.

name: Joe Rankin
text: Went in for a senior flu shot. Was denied even though I'm a uab patient with tricare and Medicare. Nobody was in waiting room.

name: Antonia Giddy
text: I went in for right upper quadrant pain. Instead of telling me that I had gallbladder problems (which I did), he told me that I had a stomach virus (which would have been vomiting and diarrhea-symtoms that I did not have). A few days later I made MYSELF an appointment with a GI doctor and a couple of weeks later I had my gallbladder removed. At UAB Leeds I received no medical treatment at all. Not even blood work or a precription for nausea. They did absolutely nothing for me at all! Waist of time and money.

name: Joe rankin
text: I'm disappointed with Dr.Williams..She didn't comply with my request for a comprehensive blood test especially after having a high cholesterol test last year..she wanted to put me on medication without knowing if I even have inflammation markers

name: Melissa Bahr
text: Dr. Gibbs insulted me on many levels, especially apologizing for upsetting my postpartum state. As if having a baby makes me incapable of making educated decisions for my children. If you are willing to blindly obey Dr. Gibbs' commands, worship her wealth of "knowledge" and not question her then this is the place for you.

name: Amber Carter
text: I have been calling since 7:30. No one is answering its after 8.  The website says they start answering the phone at 7:30 that’s untrue.

resp.text:
I’m sorry for any inconvenience.
Please call 334.364.0700 and ask for Jerry.

name: Cam Winslow
text: Absolutely love this place! My daughters pediatrician always listens to my concerns and also makes sure to tell me I’m doing a great job (being a first time mom sometimes I really need to hear that) Dr. Love is amazing would strongly recommend her to anyone!

name: Amy Wilson
text: Very friendly and attentive nurses and doctors. Our daughters pediatrician listened thoroughly and was very kind and energetic. One of the best pediatric clinics ever.

name: Dallas Roe
text: Dr Doss is a great listener and my boys enjoy visits with him

name: Jamila Mills
text: The pediatrician was extremely rude to me after I told her I opted not to immunize my child so early. Her mood immediately became nasty when I said I'd like my child to be a bit stronger before vaccinations. She even told me my breast milk won't protect him. Why are they so adamant on pumping a child with vaccinations as if they're intravenous drug users in a 3rd word country? If you're vaccinated, why are you worried about my child's immune system affecting any one else's? Disgusting, discriminatory treatment. I apparently know more about immune health and vaccination ingredients than they liked me to know. The office was extremely cold with old furniture and equipment and caution tape everywhere. It looked like someone died in there - froze my poor baby on the tables. Never again would I go to this disgusting center.

name: Elizabeth

text: I have been with this clinic for my entire life and I just absolutely love the doctors here they treat you as if you were family

name: Tammy Brown
text: I Love Dr. Nichols! She along with the other staff are in one word amazing. I've been going there for at least ten years now. Their service is swift and thorough. I wouldn't even consider taking my children any where else.

name: Heather Vaughn
text: I hope that a Dr sees this review and realizes that with unemployment rate where it is that hiring competent and polite office staff is possible. Appointments and new patient policies shouldn't be so ridiculous. I will gladly go somewhere else. Thank you, Summer, for helping see that I didn't need to bring my son to your office

name: Summer Hand
text: I love taking my children here, and my children actually love going (even when they know they are getting shots) Everyone is so friendly and helpful, I wouldn't take my children any where else!

name: Daphne Caldwell
text: I have always had a pleasant experience with both my kids. we normally do not have to wait too long unless there is obviously an epidemic. That's just the way it is with doctors around flu season.  We usually do have to wait a bit in the actual room but I have al ways been treated kindly by reception and doctors.  They are very attentive and do followups. Very good care. I LOVE Dr Taylor

name: Amy Franklin
text: My sons, who are currently 6 & 4, see Dr. Fuller! He is truly wonderful. We never have any issues with the receptionists or any other person in the office. Dr. Fuller listens and actually cares. I've never felt like an idiot mom after talking to him. I recommend him to a fee of my friends and now he has 3 more patients who see him now too.

name: Raising Wild Cubs Vlogs
text: I love it here, my kids love it, 98% of the staff is so friendly, super listening, and loving.

name: Mary Williams
text: I have nothing but good things to say about Dr. Anz, but our experience today with Dr. Glaze was absolutely horrific. He did not have my daughter’s best interest and did nothing to help her. She left the doctor’s visit in the same condition she came. I ended up bringing her back and demanding that they do something to help my sweet baby girl. She had a fever of 104.6 and her oxygen level was dropping below 93. What doctor sends a three year old home in that condition?! Needless to say, the practice has lost two patients today. I sincerely pray that no child or parent shares the same experience.

name: Madison Hinton
text:
This place is amazing! I honestly can't say enough good things about them.
My son and stepsons have doctors here and they like them as much as my husband and I.
Reception staff are friendly and try their best to accommodate you for appointment times. (I have called frantic with my infant son and they have had me in within the hour...They also accept walk-ins, but as with anywhere else there may be a longer waiting period.) The doctors my family has met with have all been attentive and genuinely care for the wellbeing of our children. The nurses have been sweet and thoughtful, as well. I've even had the doctors personally call to check-up on my boys after a visit.
In addition to the wonderful staff, the clinic also has my approval on their hours. They are open every day of the week and even have after-hours available for walk-ins. They are even open on holidays.
I would absolutely recommend The Pediatric Clinic to other parents (and I have!)

name: onyinye ekwueme
text: Nice doctors that care especially Dr. Johnson and Dr. Glaze. They're my kids' pediatricians.

name: Jessica Martin
text: God bless everyone there and everyone in this world

name: carolyn cook
text: Love this clinic.  Dr Matt Carter and staff are excellent and amazing. Wouldn't want to go to any other place.

name: Charles Phipps
text: Awful service and extremely rude staff. When I tried to bring this to the office mgrs attention I discovered that he is more rude than the staff!  His name was Jason something or other and justified his behavior by claiming to have known (and dis liked) me when we were teenagers. Is he serious?! I am 51 years old and have NO MEMORY of this clown at all! What a head case.

name: Kacy Davis
text: We had been going to pediatric clinic for the past 5 years, until this year. Majority of the group are typically rude and uncaring to patients. But this year my daughter had two episodes and was turned away. She has chronic asthma and could not breathe. Needed immediate steroid and physician, Smalley, looked in her records, saw her condition documented but refused to assist. So we transferred her records to another doctor. Today, we had to go back because it is Christmas Eve and she has stomach pain. Her physician's office is closed. Needed to have white blood cell count checked and so we went to see doctor on call. Six doctors in back with no patients, we were the only ones there. Doctor came out and told my six year old that he would not see her; go to ER. I can't tell you how mistreated we felt. I will never go back again and I urge you not to either, From one mother to another, its a very sad feeling to have your little one in your arms asking for help from the doctor and he look you right in the face and say no their doctors will not see you because you transferred your records; you are no longer part of this group, so go to ER.

name: Brandi Wilson
text: I am a very protective mother. Saying that, I trust these doctors very much! I really love the doctors and staff here. My children's primary doctor is Matt Carter, but we have been seen by most of the doctors here. I love them all. I am so glad I chose to take my children here!

name: April Eblin
text: Horrible reception when trying to make an appointment every time I call. You wait forever for someone to answer just to be put on hold in hopes you'll hang up. I waited for an hour just for Dr Anz  in the waiting room.  When called back by the nurse she was rude and snatched the sleeve off my daughters arm when checking her blood pressure. I suggest everyone to not make any appointments with her. All the other patients for the other doctors were being called back in a timely manner while myself and the three other patients seeing her were waiting for an hour or more to be called back. I'll never make another appointment with her. I'm almost certain that I'm fixing to find my children another doctors office to be taken to. This is ridiculous!!!!!

name: April Eblin
text: Horrible reception when trying to make an appointment every time I call. You wait forever for someone to answer just to be put on hold in hopes you'll hang up. I waited for an hour just for Dr Anz  in the waiting room.  When called back by the nurse she was rude and snatched the sleeve off my daughters arm when checking her blood pressure. I suggest everyone to not make any appointments with her. All the other patients for the other doctors were being called back in a timely manner while myself and the three other patients seeing her were waiting for an hour or more to be called back. I'll never make another appointment with her. I'm almost certain that I'm fixing to find my children another doctors office to be taken to. This is ridiculous!!!!!

name: Keshawn Bradley
text: By far the worst place I've been.. I have been trying to get my child an appointment there for a month they kept saying they had to get medical records. So today I called after never receiving a call back and was told it was not there job to the records it was mine or I can just go find another doctor office I almost went down there they need to be shut down the service is horrible! I told her my child had an ear in and the er said he needs to see the doctor she said that's not there problem she must don't have kids!

name: Cheyanne Williamson
text: Love all the doctors and nurses

name: Kay Dyes
text: Love Dr. Gibbs. She is awesome and has always stayed on top of anything going on with my daughters. Ive seen a few other and like as well. Have seen a couple that i dont like. But overall great experinces. If you call first thing on a monday morning they experince high call volume so i suggest to wait later or be prepare to be on hold waiting but been great for six years so far.

name: Tiffany Johnson
text: Very Nice && Clean Place! Doctors and Nurses are Awesome

name: Mike Smith
text: Like Dr Gibbs alot miss her. She was very understanding and I miss beening in Opelika Al. Thanks y'all and miss y'all

name: April Williams
text: I've been going here since 2007. Never once had a issue with making appointments, staff,  or doctors. My kids love their Doctor, he's  Brian Fuller. I've never been turn downed for anything, even when I call to make a sick appointment and we've been to both clinics, Opelika and Auburn. The staff has been nothing but nice, no harsh words or rudeness. Not even when my kids were smaller. And the doctor, he's been great has helped us alot with my son, he has adhd, he listened to our concerns when we talked about treating it the first time and told us our options and what he recommended. My son has been on the same medicine for 3 years, never had a problem. And if by chance we did, making a call for appointment and discussing the issue was a breeze. Yes, I recommend this clinic because it's a great place.

name: Ken Dell
text: Very good place to take kids, but depends on which Dr you have.

name: Barbara Parker
text: Been trying call to make an appt. Hung up on 5 times, then it's like they disconnected their phone lines. 1st time I called I waited 5 minutes on hold. Receptionist answered and asked if I could hold and I said yes, then she hung up on me and haven't been able to reach them since.

name: LaQuetta Woods
text: All the doctors are good but one of the nurse practitioners can be very rude.. I still recommend them to any and all

name: Rockyy Pitts
text: Made an appointment with Dr. Anz, ended up waiting an hour to be called only to be told that she was running an hour and a half late and there would be a wait. Rescheduled appointment for the next day only for my child to be misdiagnosed . We were told that excuses would be provided for the day before (when Dr. Anz was late) as well as the day of. When signing out they refused to provide excuse for the day that Dr. was running late. I asked to speak with Dr. and was told to have a seat to wait. While waiting the receptionist could clearly be heard gossiping about the situation (keep in mind this is the same receptionist that rescheduled the appointment and said she would the excuse the next day). Dr. never showed her face. I then spoke with a male "supervisor" who was very rude and went on to roll his eyes and state that he apologized for our experience. Yeah right! This has to be the rudest most unprofessional doctor's office I've ever been to. I'll be looking into another doctor. I would not recommend Dr. Anz to anyone. For an "educated guess" we could've went to EAMC er which is just as bad!

name: Monica Crist
text: As stated above Receptionists are hit and miss as to whether or not they are rude or cordial at best.  Jerry, the office manager is one of the most rude, unkind, condesending, uncouth, tactless individuals that I have honestly ever had the unfortunate displeasure of speaking with. As a paying CUSTOMER, I prefer to be treated with respect, not like garbage by some guy with an little dog, big bark syndromw because he is surrounded by doctors and has a complex about it. With that said, all the doctors and nurses that I encoutered were very nice, and made me feel welcomed.  However, had I stayed in Alabama, I would have certainly found another clinic due to the rudeness/unprofessionalism offered by the admin side. I am still dealing with the office about a billing issue and trying to get some resolve, all the while being treated like an absolute piece of trash by Jerry, the office manager because I am a single mother doing the best that she can. Don't end up like me!  Best piece of advice, word of mouth means something for a reason!  Majority wins for a reason!  Read the reviews, the proof is in the pudding.

name: Sharon Michelle
text: Can't say enough about the Pediatric Clinic. They have a wonderfully professional staff and very experienced doctors.

name: Tiffani Adams
text: I miss Dr. Anz!!!

name: brittany latisha
text: I love this Clinic the staff is amazing

name: Casey Ellis
text: It’s a good place to take your child for shots are whatever but they told nothing was wrong with my son said it was just upper respiratory infection come to find out he had croup which is serious and refused to treat my oldest son for being lactose intolerant so his school would know it’s ridiculous

name: Google User
text: Friendly staff

name: Rachel Dunn
text: I love it

name: Sayda Zelaya
text: Exelent

name: J O C E L Y N
text:
Dr Laue took excellent care of my children from infancy to school age. When we moved away, I missed the well-oiled
machine that this practice is. No matter what day of the week, Huntsville Pediatric Associates were available to see my children and advise me on how to take ideal care of them. They’re excellent pediatricians, every one.

name: Teresa E Manning
text: We couldn’t be happier with our decision to take our newborn here. Dr. King is new to the practice but is an AMAZING pediatrician. The lactation consultant and nurse practitioner on staff are wonderful, too. We highly recommend this place and Dr. King.

name: F. Slate
text: We LOVE LOVE LOVE Dr. Gunter. She is so amazing with my kids. I have a senior in high school and a kingergarden student, both love her. They get you in quickly if a child is sick and they make sure to give you plenty of notice if a checkup is coming up soon.

name: Billy V
text: I do not enjoy this practice at all. We moved our other two children to a different pediatric dentist.  Our youngest has involved dental issues so we thought it best to leave her where her orthodontist is familiar with her case. My daughter reports that staff are unfriendly and she does not like going. I wish we had made a different choice when she was younger.

name: Windy Geisinger
text:
Billing department has been horrible to deal with. Very unprofessional unwilling to look into the billing further because my children have been dismissed as patients!! I asked because of a $26.00 bill that I’m willing to pay? I was told no because of a $26.36 bill that You didn’t pay! I’m in complete disbelief! It hasn’t  even been a full 3 months! I called the insurance company today and they said I should not have been billed!! The billing department said this was decided by our doctor not them so they are not responsible. I asked if I could talk with someone that could work this mistake out and was told no.
I am shocked at the treatment I have been given and the finality of this decision over $26.36. We have been with this practice for many years, never missed or been late for an appointment for both my children. This is the first time we have ever had an outstanding balance.

name: Tracey Thomas
text: My children have been patients here for almost 5 years. When we first move here I didn’t think I could find a pediatrician that was as good as the one we left but thankfully we found Dr. Klemm. He is always spot on and his nurse Terri is so great and always remembers my kids. They will get you in same day if your kids are sick and even on the weekend! If I call the on call service they are quick to respond.

name: Kristen Rogers
text: I love HPA and Dr. Laue. We have always gotten in quickly occasionally even a few minutes before our actual appointment time. The nurses are always friendly towards me and my kids. Dr. Laue listens to my concerns about my kids. We have never had an issue getting a same day appointment for sickness.

name: Morgan Barlock
text: My husband and I LOVE Dr. Todd and her sweet nurse! They are so personable and love my son as their own so it seems. The office always accommodates and gets us in on the same day! I am a first time mom and they help me so much! I trust Dr. Todd and am so comfortable with her and I know she has my sons best interest at heart! Love the new location! So clean and spacious! I’ve seen two other doctors there and they have also been great! I have no complaints! Seems as if you just pay your bills and are kind you won’t have any problems! Seems sensible. WE LOVE HPA!!

name: Holly Anderson
text: They do not take Medicaid

name: Grayson Johnson
text: We love our physician there but the on call staff is horrible. Tayshia (unsure of spelling) could not have been more rude to us. She showed ZERO empathy or compassion towards me, was short and dismissive. I will be seeking care elsewhere due to her lack of professionalism and CARE.

name: Emily Gallogly
text: I rarely have a long wait and Dr. Todd is a wonderful pediatrician. She is patient, kind and willing to listen to your concerns.

name: Grace McCafferty
text: I am utterly dismayed by the billing department. I was a patient in this practice with Dr. Cochran since birth. When I had my two children, they began seeing Dr. Klemm. I have not had an issue until recently. Their father and I are divorced, so the kids are on his insurance. Last year, one of their policies was showing two plans for my daughter, so Tricare wouldn’t pay due to them requesting OHI, but there was not another plan in existence to give info to them. There was an outstanding balance due to this. I personally called the billing department multiple times. Each time, I was assured a note was placed on the account. Their father was deployed, so I had to call the insurance companies trying to resolve. Since I was not his wife, it was required for him to speak regarding this. I gave all notices and information to their father as well as HPA billing. He stated that he also called and spoke to the billing department at HPA regarding the situation at hand. Yesterday, I called HPA to make a sick child appointment for my daughter. She has been treated with allergy drops by an allergist, so this was the first time in over a year we’ve had to make an office visit. I was transferred to the billing department after making the appointment. The lady, Evelyn, stated that if the balance was not paid in full by the end of her appointment, a dismissal letter would be issued to Dr. Klemm, releasing both of my children from the practice. I questioned hadn’t their father contacted regarding the matter, because I was notified he had. She showed no care whatsoever. When we arrived for the appointment, I paid the balance in full. I requested and received a copy of my check showing the payment was made. Not even an hour and a half later, I received a hasty voicemail from Evelyn stating that she saw where we did not pay the balance, so she had discussed with Dr. Klemm the situation, and he would be signing the dismissal letter, and the decision would be final. I immediately called back when I received the message, but Evelyn was out to lunch. The lady I spoke to on the phone was very kind. She apologized and assured me, she would take matter into her own hands and remove the dismissal letter. She stated checks stay downstairs at the front office until Monday morning, so that’s where the disconnect came in due to them having a new system, and this balance was from the “old” system. I called back over an hour later requesting to speak to Evelyn. I was placed on hold for a matter of time, and the kind lady returned to the phone, apologizing that she hadn’t told her in person the payment was made, but now she had, and everything was taken care of. It’s very unfortunate to experience this, as I feel the need to find care elsewhere for my children if possible due to this situation. If in the future insurance has an issue again, and the billing department will not step in to resolve or give any guidance in a resolution, will this happen yet again? Just know, if you choose this practice, stay on them about having the correct insurance information. After visits, I would follow up to ensure the claims were filed correctly, and there is no balance. If there is a balance, request every piece of information to ensure it truly is an expense to you, and not an oversight for an insurance issue.

name: Lara Pitek
text: HORRIBLE patient services.  The people at the front have always been rude when we’ve gone in but today takes the cake.  We faxed over my daughters school vaccine request two months ago....the school never got it.  My husband tried faxing it several times last week and the fax machine was busy.  He called and they said “we can’t do anything about it.”  So my husband went this morning because we need the form by tomorrow....after waiting for a long time and being told it was $10 they came back out and said it would be an extra $25 to expedite even though it was their fault we had to do it this way.  Good luck if you ever need anything from the clinic.

name: Rachel Noles
text: Both of my children, ages 9 and 4, have been patients here since birth (as well as myself from 4 years up to 18 years) and they have always taken such good care of us. Dr. Patz is our doctor and we just love and adore him. The new office is great, and the HPA team is amazing! Thank you guys for everything!

name: Maryn Graves
text: Thank you Huntsville Pediatrics for walking us through how to get a bead out of our son’s nose today while we avoided waiting at Urgent Care for two hours. Y’all rock!!!

name: Elizabeth H.
text: We love Dr. Patz, he is wonderful.

name: RIchard Alexander
text: I am a new member of the Huntsville area.  I have 5 children ages 13 to 1.  Huntsville Pediatrics Associates was a recommended doctor group by some of my neighbors.  After multiple phone calls to the staff inquiring how to get my family in their care and some technical difficultly filling out the online application (it took me four hours to get this done because of compatibility issues), I was able to submit my application.  The issue I have is after multiple phone calls to the staff, not once did anyone indicate the patient list may be full.  I spent hours completing their requirements, only to be informed that I would not be accepted and could try again next month if I desired. I understand being full, but why waste my time.  I spoke with Kerrie, the new patient coordinator, who was extremely polite and seemed sympathetic to my predicament, but was left with no options.  I believe everything happens for a reason, but if it is this process driven and cumbersome just to try and become a patient, how difficult is it to get an appointment or try to settle an insurance claim?  Feeling a bit frustrated and dissatisfied with the level of misinformation associated with this practice.  The two star rating is for Kerrie.  She was the only bright spot in the entire experience.  I left my phone number.  Maybe one of the doctors will care enough to reach out and assist or help me get established with one of their colleagues.

name: Lauren Dauro
text: There is no question as to why these doctors are so popular - they are the best. The advice nurses are FANTASTIC and we have never had an issue getting a timely appointment for an illness - we have seen most of the doctors in the practice and all of them are very compassionate.  I appreciate they are open every day of the week for emergencies, and conveniently located in the med mall in case you need any xrays.  The office is a well-oiled machine.  Being that they are so busy, you do have to call well in advance to schedule well check ups, and if you are expecting, register with them well in advance!

name: Nicole Lewis
text: Dr Gunter is phenomenal. She is personable and very thorough. Her nurses are just as awesome. My children have been under her care for 9 years.

name: Amanda Melton
text: My son was a patient there for his very first check up after birth. We left to Florida for 2 months and came back to hsv,  they said we had to fill out all new paperwork like he was a new patient all over again. The receptionist was very rude about the whole conversation. I would strongly advise to look at other pediatricians before choosing this one.

name: Angela Anderson
text: Dr. Cochran was my 25 y/o daughters pediatrician and still my 5 y/o daughter! She has always listened to any of my concerns and VERY THOROUGH!

name: LaTerra Spurlock
text: I love this office.  Our doctor, Dr. Timothy Stewart, is one of the most amazing and caring doctors.  When we moved from AZ, I was afraid that I may not find a doctor as caring for my children as the one we had in AZ.  We have been visiting Dr. Stewart's office since 2006 and we have not once thought about changing doctors.  My kids love him and I trust him with their care.  Thanks for taking care of my babies.  :-)

name: Kristi Sears
text: I loved it when my kids were there. We changed insurance and they no longer wanted to deal with us. I have an outstanding bill with them that I wasn't aware of until recently. I have called 8 times trying to speak with someone to pay the bill. Every single time the receptionist hears that I owe them, she hangs up on me :). I simply want to pay you the money that I owe you.

name: Mike Nichols
text: We have been taking our now 17 month old to HPA since birth and have been very pleased overall.  Our pediatrician is Dr. Gunter and we absolutely love her- very personable and easy to talk to. She takes time to listen to our questions and concerns and provide us with guidance.

name: Jennifer Swoboda
text: Dr. Cochran, Caroline and all of the staff are absolutely wonderful.  My 9 year old loves Dr. C because she has the best rapport with both her young patients  and their parents.  She's the best!

name: Chad
text: Have been really happy with the care provided to our children.

name: Haley Bittinger
text: We LOVE Dr.Cochran, Dr.Gunner and Dr.Todd!! They all 3 have very good bed side manner and they love your babies as if they're one of their own! WE LOVE HPA DOCTORS, NURSES and STAFF!! :)

name: Wesley Clutts
text: My twins have gone here for two years. We have never once had a negative experience. We love doctor Todd and would highly recommend her!

name: christian shar
text:
Filed out their online form for new patient info( which is a pain to even find online the only way they accept). Waited two weeks and had to call them to see if we had been accepted. When your listed with insurance company as taking new patients why would you need to accept.
After being told that no Doctors are excepting new patients and not even being informed about this. I will be contacting my insurance. This is a blatant denial of medical care. Poor office management.

name: Kristy Compton
text: I have 3 children that have seen Dr Stewart and Dr Ellis for the past 10 years. I love and trust them both! Dr Stewart's nurses are incredible.They always take the best care of my children and if there is a problem they will not stop until they figure out how to resolve it! No practice is perfect, the only issue I have is their check in/check out staff seems to always be pre-occupied with their phones rather than their patients who need assistance. The billing office is knowledgeable and helpful as well.

name: Megan Nichols
text: If you choose not to vaccinate or choose an alternative schedule this is not the practice for you. Be prepared to be talked to like you are killing your child and you are less informed and a bad parent. When really you are obviously more informed if you have done all your research to decide on your own what is right for you.

name: Lewis Edwards
text: Great doctors and a fine supporting staff.  The after hours advice nurse and weekend shot clinic are also very valuable.

name: Kara Pleasant
text: Dr. Ellis is the BEST!!!! I have 3 kids and have been with him for the last 11 years. I would not think of going to anyone else!!!!

name: аварийный монтер Hunter
text: Love the doctors, nurses and lactation consultants..but the front desk staff needs to go through customer service training as their faces and attitudes seem to be sucking on a lemon. A little courtesy goes a long way.

name: Music Lover
text: Do not take your child here. By the time my baby turned 2 months they had called & canceled 3 of his appointments claiming each time the doctor was sick. By the time he turned 3 months I went & found him another pediatrician because he was 3 months & had yet to have his 2 months shots due to all the cancellations. & this office has the nerves to send me a letter stating they could not see him anymore due to the missed appointment. They are a bunch of slackers & if you care about your child DONT take them there!!!

name: Jason Edmonds
text:
Warning This Review Is Long but it does have a Point!!!!!!
I thought I would share with you my certified dismissal letter from Huntsville Pediatric Associates after having been a patient there since My daughter  was born. Dr. Cochran and her sweet nurse Caroline have been excellent care providers throughout her entire life. She 100% trusts her as her pediatric physician.
The other day I go for check up after an ear infection for which I suspected was fine. I waited patiently for 45 min and then told the receponist that I could not stay til 12n because I was taking someone to the doctor Can I come back tomorrow? she left and came back and said I was next. I have 45 more min. 30 min later I go and ask her why they cant just notify people when the doc is this far behind for which she had a sarcastic answer, Can I come back tomorrow?
The nurse comes out huffy and takes me behind the door of the waiting room. I proceed to ask. Where else besides the Doctor is it acceptable to wait over an hour with no explaination?? Well the Doctor is running behind what could we do about it??blah blah I got very condescending with suggestions and passionately expressed my dissaproval for not just letting me come back another day the first time I asked. blah blah Come back tomorrow morning.
I knew things might be icy, but I was told that I hurt the nurses feelings and I explained my side of the story calmly. The doc says she agrees with some of my suggestions and maybe they could explore some technological solutions. I express to her that I was never upset because they were behind but the total lack of consideration for my responsibilities I had that day and the poor conflict management skills.
Now my poor 11 year old child who has no dog in this race is forced to make a new relationship with a physician right at puberty  because I had a bad day and lost my temper and talked down to the nurse!!!
No conversation, No phone call, A certified letter!! Not someone else in the family will have to bring her if she wants to continue. Im sure I had more than one strike on my record because I am human and I am passionate, But should mercy extend to 3 bad days, 10 days in 11 years?? This is the limit of the compassion of the staff (Not the Physicians or sweet Caroline)
I say this only to say... Is the world Topsy Turvy? My poor daughter...I hope she will extend me Grace and forgive me for my transgressions.

name: Sara Stephens
text: The staff from this location came to my daughter’s school yesterday and gave her a flu shot without my permission!!!!

name: Nathan Tacha
text: A very kind and competent practice!  They were very helpful to us.

name: John Price
text: Atrocious.

name: latasha Wright
text: I appreciate the flexibility of scheduling, I have called needing to walk in and was able to get in the next day. That means alot being a new mom. The doctor is very thorough in answering any questions I have had regarding my baby. The wait time is also very minimal there which helps when you are a working mom taking off for appointments.

name: Jennifer Bastian
text: Best primary care Doctor that I have ever  experienced. Your appointments are timely, no waiting either in the waiting room or for the doctor. Dr. Bista is very thorough, professional, and addresses all your concerns. He is excellent at explaining things to you in terms that you understand. I have recommended several of my friends and family to Dr. Bista. They have all been pleased as well. The staff are very professional, friendly and will do their very best to help with appointments, refills or any other requests that I have had. I also love their patient portal, it is user-friendly and makes some request faster. I highly recommend this facility to anyone who is looking for a family care doctor!

name: Georgina Jazbinsek
text: Everyone is caring & courteous. They take the time to ensure you get the proper care. Dr. Bista is very compassionate and really listens to your questions and concerns.

name: Kayla Savage
text: Dr. Shrestha too great care of my kids during both well and sick visits. They were comfortable with her and she explained everything very well. She also inspired my kids to have self confidence.

name: Amanda Sullivan
text: My family and I love Dr. Shrestha, she's very thorough, kind and and overall great doctor. The office staff is great as well!

name: Lura Hamilton
text: Dr. Bista has always taken his time in listening to me. He truly cares for his patients and it shows. I would recommend him to any of my friends or family.

name: Hannah Filgo
text: Never had a problem with any of the staff or how it was being run. Always is clean. BUT since they were busy the doctor gave her the shot instead of the nurse who usually does it and the DOCTOR gave her the wrong shot. Very irresponsible. Thankfully it's not harmful to my child this time but it could have been. Because of this we are changing doctors.

name: L. R.
text:
I cannot brag enough. Dr. Shrestha goes the extra mile to make sure your baby is healthy and happy. She makes herself available (which is a hard thing to find with ANY doctor in Huntsville) and is patient and attentive. Her staff is also a joy to deal with.

Keep it up ladies!

name: Erica Simmons
text: Dr. Shrestha has been our daughter’s doctor since birth. She’s always friendly and attentive. She always listens to our concerns, and gives solutions while putting our minds at ease. The nurses are always kind and gentle. We’ve never had an issue. The office staff are always friendly as well. We recommend Primary Care Pediatrics and Dr. Shrestha.

name: Kathy E
text: Always courteous, professional care. Everyone from reception to the doctor takes the time to be sure you are cared for.

name: Donna
text: Dr. Bista has been our doctor for years. He, as well as his staff, are great

name: Deadly Freyja
text: We love Dr Shreshta. She’s great with our daughter. The nurses are great and so is the office staff. Being new parents, I tend to overreact and call over everything sometimes and they never made me feel bad about it. If they’re able to, they’ll even squeeze us in to make sure it’s nothing serious.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words. This is rewarding and satisfying to our staff and doctors.

name: Celese Sanders
text: I had high hopes. I've been trying to find a doctor in the area since we moved here a year ago. I was thrilled to hear this office had an opening for my three children. I filled out all of the paperwork and faxed it in. (SO much work for three kids). I called and checked. They had received the paperwork. They were going to get the files from their previous Doctor and then call to set up appointments. They never called. I called two more times but still didn't get a reply back and never got appointments set for my kids. I'm moving on to find another doctor.

resp.text: We are very sorry to hear, what happened to you. I am not sure why did not you get the call back.  We have worked on to improve our weaknesses and will continue . Thank you for your feedback.

name: B H
text: Dr Shrestha is someone I highly recommend. I have visited several pediatricians in the area and was very pleased with Dr.Shrestha when we found her. She listens, takes time to talk through everything at each of my kids visits, has an after hours call line, wonderful staff,and she even suggested us other pediatricians for us when we moved out of the area but we decided not to leave her. We now drive 46 minutes to see her. It is definitely worth it in my book.

resp.text: Thank you Ms Henson for your Continuous Love and Support. We are very greatful.

name: Unnati Patel
text:
This doctor  is very friendy and knowledge doctor
I recommende to visit this clinic

name: Brittany Shinault
text: My whole family goes here. The kids see Dr. Shrestha who is very attentive and she listens to concerns. My husband and I see Dr. Bista who is also great. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you Ms. Shinault. We Appreciate your support. We will try best to help our patient's Concerns.

name: Lowell Staton
text: I as a single man with 3 grandbabies really fell in love with the Dr. and staff here . They are very courteous and respectful of all of our families needs....Best staff and Dr.  ever.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Lowell for your kind words. We will need more support so that we can work hard to full fill our patients and Families Needs.

name: Lizzy Potatoes
text: Love, love Dr. Strestha! So great with our son.

name: Stanley Tucker
text: Dr Bista is so down to earth  that listen  to your  problems and is real easy to talk to .parking is great .if you have to go to doctor  this is one I recommen

resp.text: Thank you so much for your support and Love. Appreciate it.

name: Brittany Sasser
text: Dr Shrestha is our pediatrician and dr bista is my primary care. They are FANTASTIC! Every time I’ve called on weekends or after hours they’ve answered and walked us through what to do. They always take great care of us. So grateful for this family and their practice!!

resp.text: Thanks Ms. Sasser. This kind of support will makes us strong to help our patients.

name: Megan Sherrod
text: Would not see my 4 year old son when he had an ear infection bc we usually see another pediatrician (his office was closed).

resp.text: Sorry, Our office in not an urgent care, we only do same day visit for our established patient only.

name: Sunrise Gervais
text: Doctor Bista has been treating my wife and I for the past 18 mos and we couldn't be happier. He is friendly, thorough-never rushed, and passionately interested in helping us maintain optimal health. His compassionate attitude and friendly staff- Brittany, RN Darlene, and Cassie are a breath of fresh air.

name: Keyome DT
text: We pay over 1k a month for insurance coverage. Because the office billed my yearly appt as a regular appt and not a yearly it was not covered 2 yrs in a row. So we played 1k for insurance and another 400.00 for blood work and patient appt because it wasnt coded correctly. The arguement is I was seen for new pt. Re seen 3 months later per MD request for " physical ". So I basically had 2 physicals. I paid out of pocket for one and insurance paid for one, 2 yrs in a row.  Then received a late notice of non payment for 60 days for a bill I never received with a pink reminder slip,  pay up or we report you. This also happened 2x. Kind staff, but I will not return. I'm not made of money.

resp.text: We are sorry, you did not have good experience. Just to clarify, New patient visit is to establish care. It is coded as new patient visit, not physical. We try our best to help our patients. Our doctors  and staff are working at their best to take care of our patient's health. We are always open for communications if there is confusion or misunderstanding regarding the bill. Please call our office and I am sure office staff will be able to help you. Thank you for your feedback.

name: Nicole W.
text: This provider no longer accepts Tricare Standard or Prime and needs to update their website as well as informing Tricare of the change.

name: Amanda Brown
text:
Let me start by saying I was very much hoping to like this physician and facility.

The lobby is nice. It’s split into two sections, one side for family care the other for pediatrics. I appreciate that there’s a sick area and a well area with toys for the children to play with while waiting. I also appreciate that there’s a tv with cable for the sick ones to stay entertained. The pediatric patient rooms are decorated in cute themes and have toys for the kids. But the buck stops there for me.

Dr. Shrestha didn’t have the bedside manner I would expect with kids. I brought my 8 year old in for an issue and the way she spoke with her was as if she was very limited on patience, and almost as if she was scolding her. My daughter picked up on this and didn’t feel comfortable talking to her the rest of the time.

Bringing my one year old in for her “one year bloodwork” was fine as well. Until they stuck my baby in her arms 2 times and started to go for her feet until my husband told them “Absolutely not.” Finally, with one more stick (that’s totaling 3 now) they got the blood they needed and my baby has since been terrified of any medical personnel.

Since we weren’t happy with the office my husband and I have transferred care to HPA, where so far we are happy. I’ve sent over HPAs medical release form for both of my children two times now. The first time I was told “You have to use our release form.” No. I don’t. I’m required to use a HIPAA compliant medical release form (which HPAs form is) and you are required to release my records to the designated party. This was in February. Here we are at the second week of April and HPA STILL has not received my kids records. Now, my blue card is expired and the best part is there’s mass confusion between the two offices on what shots are due to my 19 month old. The two offices have different shot schedules and we can’t get PCPFM to send records to HPA so we can figure out what to do!

I’m SEVERELY annoyed and disappointed in how inefficiently this office is ran and the incompetence of the staff there. I’ve done my my part. I’ve crossed my T’s and dotted my I’s, so what’s the issue?

If you are considering this place or this physician to see your kids I have one word of advice. Don’t.

resp.text:
We are very sorry you were disappointed. Some of the paperworks are confusing which might be the reason, all confusion and misunderstanding happened.  We apologies. But just to let you know, this is the very common issue in most of the medical offices regarding medical records and it takes time.

Regarding the blood work,  it has nothing to do with PCPFM. This is the Hospital lab (Separate Entity).  We have them in our office for our patient's comfort and convenience, so they don't have to go here and there.

name: Misti Border-wynn
text: Professional staff, friendly, and Dr. Shrestha is great!!

resp.text: Thank you so much.  We will work hard to help as much a we can.

name: A G
text: Such a great place to take your kiddos. Dr. Shrestha and her staff are super sweet and the facility is top notch. We were able to get a same day appointment which was so very convenient and helped ease concerns I had with my newborn. Would definitely recommend to friends and family. Thank you Dr. Shrestha!!

name: Jada Stinson
text: Love. Love. Love this Doctor and her staff. Ended up here after my daughter's regular peditrician couldn't get her in for a sick visit. After seeing them for a follow up and another visit when again other office was too busy; we've decided to stay with this office! So glad we found them!

name: Brian
text: This office is wicked. We will forward our complaint to the district's attorney's office, and let the law decide who's right or wrong.

resp.text:
Hi Brian, Please Email me your concern or complaints
at donib_who@hotmail.com so that I can look into it, what is it about. Thanks.

name: Jessica Flores
text: I love pediatric doctor ! She works hard to help you child if they aren’t feeling well!

name: Amanda Dickey
text: Won't take Medicaid unless there new born babies

name: Sean Sigh
text: She listened (very important) to all of our concerns and issues and made all the necessary referrals and testing for our children quickly. If she disagreed with our self diagnosis, she gave detailed explanations of why our concerns may be incorrect. Almost every medical record/correspondence she has with us is also available online via an automated client portal. Her facilities were clean and kid friendly. Since she is a newer practice, appointment times are generally easy to book. We would and have recommended her to friends and family. I'm sure with her being close (and I mean close)  to Endeavor and Creekside Elementary, her practice will fill up quickly. Thank you Dr. Shrestha!

name: Sean Hagood
text: Very respectful staff really enjoyed my experience. Clean and comfortable environment.

name: Ileah Pope
text:
My daughter went to Dr. Shrestha for a few months. She’s very inquisitive. She asked questions regarding our personal lives that I haven’t experienced before, but I didn’t mind. I knew she was just trying to get as much as a background on my child as possible, and I can respect that.
We didn’t go beyond about 3 visits, because I declined a vaccination & Dr Shrestha’s policy does not allow children who will not take vaccines.
She was a great doctor who seemed to care greatly about her patient’s overall wellbeing, but if you’re one of those parents like me(who doesn’t believe in sticking and prodding your child with every single man made vaccine), then you’d be wasting your time. Her office won’t allow it.

name: c sh
text: I've been using Dr Farquar for 6 years now. My son's dad also used him when he was a child. Nothing rude, dismissive or discriminating about this man. He truly cares about his patients. He's amazing with kids. And he has a very outgoing and caring personality. Anytime I've needed to bring my child in they've always gotten me in the same day! Only way you couldn't like this man and his work is you're a problematic individual.

name: Kristi Cushman
text: All 3 of my girls love him and so do I! He is always great with them and I am always able to get them appointments whenever I need them. The staff is also great. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

name: Angel Eastep
text: There is no other Pediatrician that is that good except for Dr Crews and Dr Crews is up there with him. All of my children have seen him and one point or another. I wouldn’t send them anywhere else.

name: Sarah Wraight
text: Very poor experience. Dr. Farquhar was incredibly rude, dismissive, and quite frankly, I felt discriminated against. The pediatrician's job is to answer parents' questions with respect and decency, at the very least. My experience here was not at all like the reviews I have read. I'm not sure why I was treated so poorly, but there is no excuse for this behavior.

name: Annette Cooper
text: Dr. Farquhar is a GREAT doctor and person. He is kid and parent friendly, which is very important when providing pediatric care. He has been my daughter's pediatrician for 10 years. I can't  imagine anyone else providing her care when she sick, he is very knowledgeable and professional. Always, has an answer for any questions I have or any concerns. Overall, he is awesome and provides excellent pediatric care and his staff is very nice and friendly as well. They are all down-to-earth!🙂

name: Felicia Perry
text: Dr Farquhar and staff has been there through the best and worst of times. From checkups to hospitalizations he's been there. My kids adore him.  He's the best pediatrician in Mobile Al hands down!!

name: Marandia Thomas
text: Dr. Farquhar is one of the best doctors around! Very Kid friendly and easy to talk to! HIs staff is so pleasant and efficient. There usually isn't a wait time longer then 10 minutes. Fast, Pleasant, and knowledgeable!   I would definitely recommend him!

name: Kayleigh Pipkins
text: He is awesome and wonderful and has always been helpful I've been nothing but happy

name: Courtney Porter
text: All three of my kids Dr since birth. Best there is.

name: Hashitha Weerasinghe
text: They hardly answer the phone and when they do they are hardly useful..when they answer the phone they transfer and cut the call..did it so many times

name: Amy Conlin
text: This office is knowledgeable, caring, and professional. Dr. Albert is our doctor but we also see Dr. Levin and Dr. Stansell and have always been very pleased. We are seen the same day (sick visit) and the waiting room wait is generally pretty quick. I can’t say enough positive things about this practice.

name: Terra Mortensen
text: Dr. Levin was pediatrician and my kids have been seeing him and Dr. Stansell for 14 years. They are wonderful -- kind, calm, and understanding, and they've always taken my concerns seriously (even when I was a new mother with some pretty silly worries.) The staff is always great, too -- including the after hours nurses. I love that the waiting room is spacious and rarely crowded and that it's easy to get through to the office when I call. The nurses typically call me back quickly when I have a question, and even the billing department is friendly and easy to work with when I have a question about a bill.

name: Lauren Malbrough
text: I can't say enough great things about this practice.  I have been taking my kids here for 5 and 1/2 years, and every single doctor is amazing.  Dr. Albert is my primary, and I adore her.  She is the best balance of compassionate and understanding but also acts as the doctor and gives honest and straightforward advice/instructions.  I have had nothing but wonderful experiences with Levin, Stansell and O'Neil, too.  The wait is always reasonable, and the nurses line is handled professionally with positive attitudes all around.

name: Brian King
text: We switched to Alabama Pediatrics from a larger practice and couldn't be any happier.  Dr. Levin is our primary, but we have also seen Drs. Stansell and O'Neil multiple times and they have all been great.  We have never had an unreasonable wait in the office, or not been able to get an appointment same day when we needed one.  And a real person answers the phone ... sometimes you can even ask questions of a nurse without having to wait for a call back.  Excellent service all around.

name: Joshua Shoemake
text: I currently had a 10:45 appointment. It is now 12:10 and we are just getting back in a room. The doctors are great but this is an incredibly inefficient office, especially when you have sick babies. Everytime I come here it's such a long wait.  I have yet to understand why I had a 10:45 appointment and I'm still waiting. We will be moving offices after today.

name: Kenneth Manning
text: Great Dr's they are all awesome

name: Ashley Samuels
text: I love all of the doctors and the staff. Dr. Stansell sees both of my boys and he's excellent. He has a wonderful bedside manner, he listens and provides great advice! I highly recommend this practice.

name: Nita Schlottschriver
text: Wow, great experience. Nice office, short wait; Dr. Albert took plenty of time with us, listened, and offered several options for treatment. Definitely recommend.

name: LaKesha Douglas
text: The pediatric facility is wonderful. Dr. Levin and Dr. Stansell have been seeing my children since birth and they are all teenagers now. The doctors are very professional and the nurses are as well. I have had nothing but excellent service since I first came to this practice with my first child who is now 18. I highly recommend this pediatric practice. They work to schedule you in and also will accomodate on Saturdays if needed.

name: Charity Moore
text: I brought my son in for wheezing several times in the past year and always left with the diagnosis of RSV (despite only being tested once and not being in daycare). He's not 2 years old yet, but with frequent respiratory infections, an extensive family history, seasonal allergies and sleep apnea that required surgery, I knew he had asthma which he was refused treatment for because of his age. I called the office on December 12th for a referral to a pulmonologist because this round of difficulty breathing and wheezing was taking fairly long for him to recover from. It is now January 18th and I have yet to receive a phone call, letter in the mail, postcard, telegram, pigeon carrier, a follow-up phone call ANYTHING in regards to the requested referral OR any concern for my child's inability to breathe properly. I received a phone call that Dr. Albert wouldn't be available for his 2yr appointment and was asked if I needed to reschedule, when I expressed my concern about the service I received (or lack thereof), the nurse informed me she'd "look into what happened" to see why no one had called me back. That was Wednesday. It's now Friday and no one has reached out to me. Luckily enough, I had scheduled an appointment for Alabama Asthma and Allergy and got a confirmed asthma diagnosis with daily treatment, a rescue inhaler and a nebulizer to treat his frequent RSV in the month I waited for that referral. I will be calling the medical board to seek answers as to why his symptoms were ignored despite his documented medical history. There's also special cause for concern that with his premature birth, he was administered vaccinations that would increase his likelihood of developing respiratory infections. None of the staff discussed that or the possibility that he may be immunocompromised due to his prematurity and frequent respiratory problems. There was no information provided on the vaccinations he received in order for me to provide informed consent. It wasn't until after speaking with the doctor at Alabama Allergy that this information was presented to me or even discussed. Take your children elsewhere as this staff shows little to no concern over whether or not your child can breathe.

name: Dino Lover (Moon)
text: Love the Drs and Staff. Very friendly and professional. I used them with both my boys whom are now grown and have started over with my grandchild.
